BB 17.06.2017. almost black color, medium big coffee-colored head. smells of mint, spices, tobacco, milky, plums, nuts. ok smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes milky, spices, tobacco, cardboard, caramel, light grassy, nutty, marzipan. finishes lightly dry with notes of cardboard and tobacco. tastes rather simple and a bit on the cardboard-ish side, not a big fan, maybe some issues with my bottle.

(330ml bottle from boxbeers.dk) Pours black with a small off white head that fades to a ring. Aroma of roasted and burnt malt, moderate smoke, spent coffee grounds, ash, dark bread, slight bakers chocolate core, a little liquorice, only slightly sweet from the malt core. Flavour is slightly more sweet but still dominated by impressive layers of roasted and burnt malts, ashy, somewhat smoky, bitter black coffee, some dried fruit, liquorice, a bit of dark caramel, earth, and fairly substantial liquorice that builds into the finish. Combined with burnt malt and coffee grounds, it makes for a dry bitter finish with lingering smoke. Medium bodied with slightly above average but smooth carb. Interesting burnt/smoked profile ends up being a better pair for liquorice than expected, a dry roasty beer with surprising depth.

Bottle from Holmen1 - thanks Jan Magnus! Black as pitch with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malts and a massive taste of great complexity. Smokey flavours of bonfire and cigar ash. Lots of liquorice, coffee, dried fruit, Demerara sugar and pine resin. Excellent, rich and unctious mouthfeel. A really great stout, or double brown stout as it says on the label. A spectacularly fine beer from Thisted.

500ml bottle [another Bartlebierian gem, tak og skål!]. Jet black colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige to tan head. Bready, smoky, dark malty aroma, notes of pumpernickel, rust, bacon, coffee surrogate, chicory. Taste is bitter, roasty dark malty, slightly ashy, minimally metallic, notes of pumpernickel, a touch of treacle, char, liquorice, cautious honey interludes; full body, viscous, oily texture. Intense, heavy, neither flattering nor easy drinkable - hard and nicely dirty stuff.

Almost black color with brown head. Aroma has intense chocolate malt, fudge, caramel, roasted coffee beans, really complex. Medium body with medium to light carbonation. Baltic porter is not really one of my favorite styles but this one is quite good.

Dark brown-black body, medium to thick pale tan head, and dense lacing. Rick, bittersweet chocolate, mild char, earth, roast, and coffee. Classic porter profile. Medium to full bodied, fairly dry in the finish.

Quite an extreme porter, deep black with small brown head. Both aroma and taste complex, with roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, some coffee and somewhat smokey; heavy, full and bitter with slight sweetness. In the aftertaste the bitterness of laurel licorice lasts. Special one.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 I just realized Ive never rated this beer despite it being the beer Ive had the most of besides Grøn Tuborg/Carlsberg HOF being served at concerts, sport events and other places. When going out for beer, dice and games on small bars, I always try to find a bar with this beer and can drink this all night. An absolute favourite of mine and along with Orval it ranks so very high in drinkability and cravings. I often find myself wanting this. I may not be an alcoholic, but this beer gets me d*mn close! My rating is of course influenced by my feelings for this beer and the well known characteristics. I actually own an example of this from when Urban used to brew it. I have a few samples left from when Peter did the first experiments put out to locals and selected beer aficionados around 2005, where he used ale yeast. Ive shared this with other Ratebeerians, as I had the fortune of getting a crate of this along with crates of two other experiments. 

Bottle. Pours black with a dense, light brown head. Lovely aroma of tar, smoke, licorice. chocolate, plumbs and roasted malt. Lovely stuff. Thanks, Peter for getting this beer right and making it part of my beer drinking habits for 20-25 years.

50cl bb04/2016, Føtex Ebeltoft 09/2015. - Glad to finally get hold of this classic in the slowly rejuvenated style category of Baltic Porter. Label: "Double Brown Stout, Ekstremt Luksusøl." - Alluringly secluded aroma of tar-covered cranberries, woodsmoke, char, bitter chocolate and cold espresso. Overwhelming amounts of dried smoked liquorice in several nuances in taste, both drop/lakrids candy and liquorice root cooked as Kaffee-Ersatz aka Muckefuck (caramelised chicory root), minimal sweetness and a savoury quality going on beef jerky. - Very smooth velvet mouthfeel, no abv burn whatsoever. Lots of character in this beer and a great accompaniment to chili con carne, a bit too metallic and far less accomodating as dessert.

Bottle, from Sjøbeck Øl & Vand, thanks to Hanne for accommodating. For a dark beer lover, this was an absolutely thrilling experience. The aroma was initially quite leathery and alcohol pungent, like a rough Imperial Stout, but it soon broke down into coffee and metal notes. Not aluminium or tin. I am talking good old black, rusty cast iron. Old ploughing disks or cast iron coffee mills. Actually, theres a farming core to the scent, like from a traditional coffee farm in South America, where the berries (not beans, please) are selected through water canals. Past that phase of pure enjoyment of the nose, I must say that this is another thick oily black Danish Baltic Porter, only dark brown in the edges as it pours, with a lovely light brown head. The flavours invade the tasting buds like a pillaging horde. The liquorice and the salt! Very salty beer. Absolutely lovely, with molasses, nuts and dark chocolates, but it is the salty liquorice that stand out, like a good oyster stout, like it has been brewed with salted almonds. That salty bitterness, not too roasty, not too herbal, and it lingers on the palate for an incredible long time. There was so much coffee in the nose, but hardly on the flavour, which is good in my opinion. This is a full-body oily, chalky, creamy beauty that is among the best beers I have ever had. Theres no stopping for the hurdles of getting more bottles of this wonder from across the world.

Tap at Gingerman. Pours dark brown with nice head and lacing. Nose of dark chocolate. Tastes chocolaty, of root beer, ginger, licorice, light smoke, soy sauce, and cloves. Pretty nice lingering finish..

On tap. Pours a solid black with a brown head. The aroma has a lot of smokiness, toast, and some sweet malt. The flavor is sweet and smoky up front with a semisweet and slightly smokey finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lite drag av spya i doften tyvärr annars mycket trevliga porterdofter. Torr och fin. Denna har precis passerat "bäst före" med en månad typ. Måste man ju tänka på. Fick flaskan gratis på nordiska ölhandeln. Tack för den!
Doften är ganska dämpad med inslag av brända toner och choklad. Smaken är även den ganska dämpad. Känner viss beska, kallt kaffe samt lite frukt.

On tap at Max's in the Fell's Point distriict, Baltimore, MD. 

Opaque, very dark mahogany with a fine, creamy khaki head and outstanding lacing. 

Aroma of dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, molasses, licorice and charred wood. 

Taste of dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, caramel and licorice. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation with a mouthfeel between silky and oily.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is nice, fruit, chocolate, licorice. The appearance is dark brown, light tan head. The flavor is chocolate, bread, fruit, licorice. The finish is roasts, a bit spicy. Medium in body, slightly thick. Nicely done.

On tap at Maxs. Pours a deep brown with crimson highlights and a thin to medium sized tan head. Big roast with some smoke touches, and some thick cocoa. Medium bodied, sweet chocolate and cocoa with style plum sweetness and touches of oxidation. Dont really get any licorice initially, but theres this small pervasive hint if it lurking in the back almost unnoticed. Long cocoa and roast into the finish, more oxidized plums and dusty bakers cocoa. Tasty.

Draft at Oblivion. Pitch black pour with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of bittersweet chocolate, dry roasted malts, licorice and smoke. Very attenuated body with dry roasted malts, touch of smoke, licorice, maybe a touch of dark fruits. Pretty tasty and extremely drinkable.
Mörk/Svart öl med ljusbrunt skum! Rökig i smaken och det är inget för mig!!

Appearance:inky, near black, with a short, soapy swirl of caramel bubbles masquerading as a head. Aroma:licorice, coffee, bitter chocolate, general roast. Taste: as the aroma indicates. Finish:	sharp, slightly chewy, with lasting bitter chocolate and black licorice. Notes: Pretty standard Baltic, which is pretty darn good. On tap at Birch and Barley, DC.
Danish Classic beer. Always a high quality and allways was a bargain for the Price.

Quite nice Aroma of cherries/burnt fruit and something reminiscent of sour dough bread, not bacterial, but tart.  It also has some licorice and perhaps some burnt wood...not smoke. It has nice flavor has well.  Pretty dry and it goes in the direction of BBQ sauce, smoky and tangy.  Its fairly effervescent and medium-full bodied, not overly heavy.  It also have a wonderful, lingering palate.
a roasty aroma, smoke,  coffe.      clear dark beer, with a fine brown head.  taste light sweet and light bitter.  a oily texture with a average carbonation,  a long aftertaste

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 Flaske kjøpt på Gml.Strand øllager: denne har vært en av mine desiderte favoritter lenge før jeg fikk RBHD. En klassiker og et ikon innen dansk bryggerikunst. Et mesterverk, utrolig at man får denne over alt i Danmark til en så billig penge. For en gangs skyld er der et motsatt forhold mellom pris og kvalitet. Må prøves av alle som liker mørkt, smaksrikt øl. LIMFJORDPORTER 2004 fra flaske på Tap1 mai-13: Ovesen smiler fra øre til øre, og det gjør jeg også. O salige stund. Fra fad på Cardinal sep-13: et mesterverk på flaske, et mesterverk på fad.

On tap at the lord nelson Copenhagen. Shared. 
Thick creamy off head.  Chocolate and coffee.
On tap @ The Lord Nelson. Pours black with a tan head. Instant coffee aroma. Taste of coffee, caramel and dark chocolate, excellent rich mouth feel

A -  Best by 17/10/2012 - Dark / thin / black / brown. very thin looking no head

S - Very peaty on the nose, hint of roasted nuts

T -  Very peated / smoky, hint of chocolate at the finish. aunt jemimas syrup finish

M - medium body, little carbonation

O - Interesting but the smoked / peat malts are intense

Bottle in Copenhagen.  Thin pour with beige head.  Smell isnt too interesting - roasted barley as anticipated.  Taste is a bit thin and watery, roasted barley and ever so slightly sharp.  Initial taste is quite good but there is some vegetable in there and a nail varnish finish.

Bottle 33cl. Brown layer at the sides. Color is black. Full sugary body. Aroma is dark bread and coffee with alcohol. Hint of dry milk. Bready flavour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a black with a slightly oily texture with a big fluffy dark brown head. Aroma of wood smoke, milk powder and chocolate. Taste of lactose, dried fruit, salt and black liquorice. Medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Black with a brown head. Aroma of malt, licorice, coffee and rye. Taste with mostly the same notes plus some roasty and smoky notes. Nice beer
En riktigt god stout. Smak och doft av choklad, kaffe, malt, råd, toner av laktris och rök. Välbalanserd med trevlig beska.

Black with a brown head. Aroma of malt, licorice, coffee and rye. Taste includes a lot of the same notes, along with some surprisingly intense roasty and smoky notes. Slightly creamy palate. Delicious.

Bottle from Dedollewaitor. Jet black with a tan head. Aroma is smoked malt. Flavour is dry smoked, a little creamy with a long smoked finish. I had this before, years ago, but I dont remember it tasting this good.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2013 This is almost as black as it gets, and one have to hold a light directly at the glas to see its actually dark, dark brown. The head is fluffy and yeasty, and the weak aroma kind of dough-like. The taste is rather interesting and reminds me of Latakia tobacco and liqorice and with a highly complex malt composition. On the palate this is actually quite subtle, but with a little bitternes in the back of your mouth. Carbonated perfectly, and it never gets dull. This is a work of art, and probably the greatest Porter in the world

33 cl bottle as a gift from my brother. Pours clear dark brown with a two finger brown head. Aroma of coffee, licorice and chocolate. Medium bitter, medium carbonation, medium to light mouthfeel. Easy to drink and quite complex.

Roasted, smoky malts, sour,. Black/brown w brown small head. A perfect combination of sweetness, sourness and warm alcohol. Medium carbonated, medium thickness. Really good porter. Smoky, roasted, sweet, sour and strong.
kraftig brandt smak. masser af gode forslag til blanding bag på flasken. ikke drin som første øl.
skænkes kold i glasset.... super sort sort øl med mange lækre nuancer., hvor især den engelske lakrids går fint igennem... næsten for go at drikke alene..men....fået af Thomas Papsø..

Bottle (also had it on tap a few times). Pours blacker than black and has a beautiful brown head. Aroma is smoke and coffee. Taste is of roasted malt, coffee/cappuccino, liquorice, tar (as if I ever ate that) - very complex and full bodied. This is one of my absolute favourite beers - and has been for about 10 years. Its the best danish beer for the money it costs and fantastic value for money (it doesnt cost much more than mass-market lager) and I return to it time and time again.

It just dont get any better.
Only competition I can think of, is Ølfabrikkens Porter.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks Yoav. Pours opaque black with a nice brown to beige head, aroma of coffee, cappuccino, wood, vanilla and cherry, flavor is smoked with wood, coffee, sour cherries, malt acidity, almost full bodied

Kaatuu lasiin mustana, ruskealla, tiiviillä ja katoavalla vaahdolla. Haju on paahteinen, yrttinen, kahvinen, banaaninen ja hennon suklainen. Maku on paahteinen, suklainen, hieman yrttinen ja lopussa on ruohoista humalaa. Suutuntuma on katkera, mutta muuten mieto. Kokonaisuutena maistuva porter, joka kyllä on hieman ohut.
Bottle 33 cl. Almost black with brief light brown foam. Bouquet of harbour and liquorice. Taste medicine, iodine, liquorice and tar. Pleasure.
Mørkt, middels sterk, undergjæret stout / porter. Tungt men også friskt og bittert.....

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks Yoav. Pours dark brown with a dark tan film. Wood, a little port and phenol in the nose. Wonderful taste: wooden barrel and roast. Full body, smooth texture, deep long wooden finish.

Bottle sample.
Dark brown with a small beige head.
Aromas of coffee, ash, dark chocolate, roast and earthy hops.
Highly roasted malts flavor, with med-hi bitterness, espresso and burned wood.
Med-full bodied, complex and very nice.

Black with slight head, nice lace on the pint. Tasted tar, liquorice & roasted malt, full-bodied. Finishes with nice and dry bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 Kjøpt i dagligvare i Danmark. Svært farge med en tynn skumrand . Smaker heftig av mørkbrent malt, tjære, røyk, lakris,eik og kaffe. En av mine favoritt øl. En fantastisk god imperial stout

Smaker fortsatt helt utrolig bra

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown, with airy but stable tan head. Dark aroma of malty and coffee, with touches of roast and adrk chocolate. Delicious, complex flavour of malt and roast, enriched by well-pronounced coffee notes, gradually replaced by hints of liquorice. Pleasant, lingering dry aftertaste of liquorice, turning salty as it recedes. Great beer.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 
Bottle from a brewery gift-pack. Pours a black-brown with a slightly oily texture hidden by a big fluffy dark brown head. On the nose are peat and wood smoke, malted milk and chocolate, then the body is huge, initially almost sweet with burnt treacle coming through, then turning drier and bitter with a little dark dried fruit and black liquorice coming through, and finishing smoky and astringently bitter with a salty note and the faintest underlying hint of syrup. This is an Imperial/double stout as it says on the label, not a Baltic porter as it says on RB, but either way it is great stuff!
Dejlig kraFtig og smagfuld. God bitterhed og nuancer fra lakrids og chokolade til tørv og røg.

New Beer Distributors, NY 330ml ($4): Pours black with a  light brown head. Aroma is anise, chocolate, smoky-burning thing, and fruitiness. Taste is much the same. Body is rather light. There is a slight amount of booziness. Mouth feel is nice and creamy. Chocolate taste, kind of like hot chocolate, except with more burned roasted malts. This is well-balanced, while at the same time nicely scattered around a number of different flavors. This is for sure one of the better porters that I have had.
Den bedste stout man kan komme i nærheden af. For mig er den referencepunkt for alle andre øl. Det er toppen af ølbrygning.

Bottle. Pours black with small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, roasted caramel, licorice, coffee, ripe sweet red apples, hints of smoked ham. Taste is medium to heavy bitter and light to medium sweet in excellent balance. Body is creamy with soft carbonation. Finish is long and pleasantly bitter with warmth from the alcohol. Notes of coffee, caramel, toffee, hazel nuts, licorice and brown bread. A very pleasant stout!

Bottle at home. Two finger foam light brown. Black color with brown notes. 
Aroma; tar, coffe and pine ?
Lots of bonefire taste ;). 
Nice porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in a snifter.  Pours black with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma roasted malts, chocolate and coffee, some spiciness, plus some floral hops, and some pine/herbs or something.  Flavor the same, with an interesting finish.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good beer.

A-- Poured a dark cola color and settled plain and simple black. No light penetrating the glass. Half finger of dark brownish chocolate head. Head fades pretty quickly to a light brown film. Half circle of lacing on the side of the glass. 

S-- Interesting smell. Went from original earthy chocolate, coffee and herbal licorice to a chocolate, Carmel covered orange peel that was still very earthy, or shall I say dirty and herbal. Interesting. 

T-- Cold, grity, and old earthy chocolate and coffee. Get Carmel and vanilla as well but really more about the earthiness of this. 

M-- Vanilla and Carmel in the front and coffee and licorice in the back. Lots of coffee acidity in this as well. Very clean with a lot of acidity in the finish. Low carbonation and medium feel. 

O-- Nice beer. True to style. Not overbearing in any way at all. No gaps or issues with this at all. Alcohol is well hidden and a lot of character to this. Would try this again if got the chance.

Bottle shared.  Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, light smoke, leather and coffee.  Flavour is medium sweet an light bitter, going into a smokey slight salty finish.  Light full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Byens Kro , Copenhagen. Quite a find with the help of some Danish beer fans. A light head with little lacing. Almost no aroma, but a really smooth porter packed with flavour. A very drinkable beer that could easily be drunk all night long. Not too pricey in a bar either and it can easily be sourced in supermarkets too. A wonderful porter that I will drink again... I hope!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very dark porter/stout style beer. Very smokey in flavour imagine a barbequed guiness. Quite pleasant but not a beer you would want a lot of.

Solid black with a good beige head that leaves behind some lacing. Aroma is liquorice, chocolate, leather, sandalwood, soy sauce, touch of smoke. Slightly oily mouthfeel, slightly roasty bitter finish with a hint of booze. Taste is liquorice, oak, burnt sugar, chicory. Possibly in need of a little aging.

Pours a dark black. The nose is fig, anis, bourbon, vanilla, and oak. The pallet is starts coffee followed by bourbon, vanilla, anis, and finishes with coffee and bitter chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 0.5 bottle. Color is jet black and the head really brown, big and of great retention; it also leaves a decent lacing. Aroma is roasty and smoky, some wood is detectable alongside, seems to be bitter.  Bittersweet taste, strong and solid yet discreet and not irritating. Genius palate comprising of full body, thick and creamy texture together with a nearly flat carbonation. Only the finish is a bit off with small sour drops. Extremely good beer, goes decently with food.

Must have gotten a bad bottle. This was not good with a nasty sour aftertaste. There is much more enjoyable porters. I searched desperately for the promised smoky taste which must have been hiding among all that sour.

Brown head, dark body, Smells strong alcoholic, roasty. It tastes roasty, creamy, a bit alcoholic. But on the other hand it is a bit mild, so a combination with strong flavours and a mild-creamy underground. Good one! 12/12/11/12/11/12

Found an old tasting note:
Jet black colour, big roasted coffee/espresso aroma and a real cask iron skillet note. Big brew, rich taste, long finish and everyting a porter should be.
excellent.
dark brown with beige head. powerfull delicious flaver, with fragments of smoke and coffee. a beer that deserves attention and a big cohiba!

Bottle thanks to humlelala! Pours a clear near black, deep mahogany. Sheen, creamy foam. Nose is sour, smokey, big time lemon iced tea. Taste is lactic, smokey, rich, more iced tea. Very strange though I kind of like it. Really a unique beer.

Draught. Near black with a lasting head and some lacing eventually. Roast and liquorice immediately making themselves felt, along with some coffee notes. Smokey and fruity at times, which makes for an interesting experience. Thick and chewy. Also meaty. Yes, meaty. This is the meatiest beer Ive had up until now. If you think you can handle all that then this is a beer for you. I can see why its a bit of a cult classic amongst the Danes and Id gladly have it again.

Soft and sweetish with a twist of laquorish.
Black or brown with very distinct, thick foam.
One of the early starters of the Danish beer revolution.
A very thick flavor of smoke and liquorish. Allmost oily in palate. Black in color with a creamy head.

33cl bottle from trade with Fonefan, shared with Dutchdrebus. Pitch black, totally opaque color, small light brown head that leaves some lacing. Smell burned malts and some smoke. Taste burned malts, hints of coffee, smoke, a hint of (Dutch) hopjesvla. Soft carbonation, medium to full body.

Completely opague, pitch black colour with a big off-white head. Smells roasty, coffee, coal, alcohol, smoky. Tastes roasty, coal, some peatyness, very burned, some dark chocolate, smoky, ash. Full body, great fitting carbo, nice long aftertaste.

Bottled, 0.33l. Pours hazy dark brown with frothy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and coffee. Sweet chocolate start, followed by pleasant mouth-coating feeling and changed to abrupt bitter finish. Full body, thick oily texture and no carbonation in palate. Very good one...

33 cl bottle shared with gnoff.

Black with a small tan head.  Huge roasted malt aroma with coffee and smoke.  Those aromas carry over into the taste, which has also tar and charcoal and a hint of licorice.  Round velvety mouthfeel, dry finish.

[Thanks to fonefan]. 50cl bottle. Black colour with a frothy and dense tan head. Nice lacing and perfect lasting. Toasty, spicy and smoky aroma. The flavour has a moderate toasted malts hints, roasty, smoky, with hints of wood and slightly spicy. The final has an average bitterness with a medium persistence. Carbonation is medium. Body is high.

Bottle: Trade with Fonefan, thanks:
Medium to a slowly changing smaller brown head on top of a black beer.
Looks good.
The aroma consists mostly out of coffee and roast with hints of smoke, coal, ash and roasted barley malts.
Wow the mouthfeel and flavours are extremely soft.
Taste is a good mix of deep roasted almost burned malts/barleys, espresso, good bitter, dark chocolate, tar and coal, burned wood, dry bitter hops, coffee roast.
All very gentle and delicious packed. 
Aftertaste is a mix of coffee, roasted, bitter, some dark dried roasted fruits and espresso.
Low to medium carbo, soft mouthfeel, full body and a creamy (light oily) texture.
Good looking, nice smelling, lovely balanced, delicious tasting, almost perfect! Not to complex but deep and really good (roasted) tasting.
Note: drank this when eating a pie.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
330ml bottle.
Pours almost pitch black, with a brown head.
Complex, roasted aroma, dark chocolate, cappucino, malt, cocoa, tobacco, spicy notes, chestnut.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, medium bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, heavily roasted taste, chocolate, coffee, tar, faint smoke, malt, caramel, toffee, licorice. (2012-03-06)

Draught @  Orsted Ölbaren, Copenhagen 25/2/2012. Poured black with a brown creamy head. Liquirice in aroma, along with nice roastedness and light coffee aroma. Flavor very similar, very smooth, quite dry finish.  More coffee in finish. Full bodied. Great.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 28.04.2012
Aroma is somewhat fruity with roasted malt, licorice and hints of coffee. Also hints of berries typical to danish ales. Thick palate. Flavour is roasted with some hops, licorice and berries. Good, even though I expected more. I would like this more with less hops.

330 ml bottle. BBE 28.04.2012.
Pours a black colour with a thick, beigeish head. Aroma roasted malts, dry wood and coffee. Flavour of roasted malts, dry wood, coffee and some milk chocolate. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and a dry finish of coffee and milk chocolate. Nice one.

33 cl bottle. BBE 28.04.2012.
Pours black colour with large off-white head. Aroma of burnt wood, ripe fruits, liquorice, some vegetable notes and smoke. Flavour of mild berries, caramel, toffee, malts, smoky ham, wood and some yeast. Nice.
4515

330ml bottle from Systembolaget

Pours pitch black with a foamy light brown head. Aroma has notes of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, wood and light smoke. Taste has notes of chocolate malts, slight roastiness, coffee and hints of wood, berries and light smoke. Finish is quite roasty and fruity. Well balanced, tasty porter.

Classic beer, had a hard time rating this as i drank gallons of it over the course of many happy years of marriage with this beer. It looks pitch black with a beautiful light brown foamy head. It tastes and smells roasty with coffee, chocolate and a bit of rye if you ask me. Feels really nice and thick and fills the mouth with a thick and cummy feeling of well-being. I mind this beer, you can buy it from Super-Brugsen

Pour opaque dark, with a big foamy beige head. 
Aroma of Coffee, roasted malts. A little oatmeal, a little bit of chocolate. 
The taste is quite bitter/sweet. 
Medium body, with a fizzy carb. 
This is a lot of beer for the the buck.
(Bottle 25/12-2011) low brown head, black color, roasted chocolade aroma, slightly bitter roasted coffee taste. BB date 01.07.12.

Picked this up at Downeast Beverage in South Portland, Maine thanks to a recommendation by an employee.

Pours a deep, dark brown, almost black, with a tan head. The head recedes to a thin layer of fuzzy foam but retains well. A gentle swirl brings it back. Quite a bit of lacing. Aroma - wow! Almost exactly like chocolate-chip cookies that stayed in the oven about 5 minutes too long. Intense chocolate, biscuity malt. Little in the way of the dark fruit aromas. Smoky. Taste is dry, roasty, lots of dark chocolate and dark bread crust. Cant really pick out the licorice here. Finishes maybe just a little on the dry side, some deeper malt flavors might round out the taste a bit. Mouthfeel is spot-on, smooth and velvety and very full. Because of the relative dryness and overall amazing chocolate flavors I would love to drink another.

Overall, I am really impressed with this beer. Will definitely grab a few more bottles of this.

Thx to Phredrik ! 
Head: firm, thick, creamy, dark off white 
Colour: black 
Smell: roasted nuts, roasted malts, deep dark chocolat, coffee, very very nice ! 
Taste: start is ashy , also a very weird raw pork like taste , irony , very peppery , lots of smokeyness as well , roasted malts, now the taste softens a bit into some fine bitter coffee , chicory actually , end is very bitter with a grassy fruity aftertaste , good but that pork like thing was very weird .... i also think it will be a even better beer when its aged a year or 2 ....

.5 litre bottle courtesy of a trade with Rasmus40.  Pours black with a moderate brown head that lasted until nearly mid-glass and laced the glass well.  The aroma is simply wonderful with roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and dark fruit.  The flavor focuses a bit more on the roasted malt with a bit of a burnt quality along with chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and molasses.  Medium bodied; your palate is expecting something heavier given the color, aroma and flavor. This is a delicious beer!

Denmark, Aug-Sept 2009. Great to find such a great beer in great price and wide availability at least to its country. I wish we had somethign similar in Greece. Black with tiny brown head. Roasted malta aroma, coffee, chocolate. Similar taste. VEry enjoyable,

bottle. pours black with a 2 finger pillowy beige head, Aroma: reminiscent of the sea or harbour, peated malt, smokey,  salami, woody, wet wood, earthy, chocolate, light grassiness,  grain, burnt hay, tar, asphalt, roasted, dried fruits, rye, medium full mouthfeel, quite smooth, Taste: some minerally notes upfront, peated malt, smokiness, light coffee, asphalt,  tovværk,  liquorice, roasted bitterness, woody, dried fruit, hard burnt malt, tar, chocolate, some dryness,  All time danish classic!!
