Bottle 50 cl...... It pours pitch black with medium brown head.... the aroma is chocolate, burnt malt and some smoke......the flavor is burnt malt, licorice, espresso, lots of burnt and smoke flavor in the finish..... Good beer :)
Dark as the night with a big brown head. Sweet licorice, tar, coffee and malt. Fresh mouthfeel. Very good.

Baltic style for sure. Not my favorite style, but this is a good one within the style. Pours nearly black with a very small tan head. Medium lacing. Aroma punches you in the face (at least if you, like me, drink it in a tulip). Its tar, tar and then some more tar. Maybe youll pick out some roasty tones as it heats up, maybe some spices as well. But its really the very smoked character that sticks out. This is more balanced in the taste, which has a nice roasty bitterness to it. The finish is fairly long and theres coffee and chocolate in there  as well. Very pleasant. I found the mouthfeel a bit light, would have wanted a bit more heft to it to balance up the heavy aroma.
Bottle, pours black with small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasty, licorice: Taste is light sweetness, medium bitterness, Good beer at a good price at Systembolaget

Det här är en trevlig öl som inleder lite försiktigt med lite sötma och en liten tendens till lakrits. Därefter kommer en len efterbeska med mycket malt, choklad och sötma. Efterbeskan är som sagt väldigt försiktig och ihållande men ack så god.

Aroma: Heavily roasted, coffe, chocolate, tar, smoked meat, brown sugar, alcohol. 
Appearance: Deep black colour, small beige head. 
Flavour: Big roasted notes, coffe, smoked meat, licorice, alcohol. Very rich. 
Mouthfeel: Average. 
Total: This one lived up to the hype.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a pitch black liquid with a small brown head. The smell is chocolaty sweet. Taste is salty with some licorice, chocolate and dark malt. Thick body, smooth mouthfeel and low amount of carbonation. I really liked the smell of this one but cant quite grasp the salty licorice taste. I would have prefered it sweeter and with more coffe and chocolate flavours.

The aroma is a bit sour and smoky with hints of roasted malt and coffee. The taste is thin with a hint of burnt coffee, licorice and roasted malt. In the finish there is a strange and unpleasant bitter tone. The beer is far too thin and harsh in taste.
Aroma is licoriche, soya, some roasted malts and some alcohol. Taste is very much as expected from the aroma, licoriche, tobacco and a good bitter finish.

Pours black with no to low head. Aromas of tar, liqourise, tar, and tar. Full body of smokiness and oakyness. Quite thin in texture. There are some bitterness but the smokyness is a bit to much for my taste.

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden.
Huge and lasting brown head.
Big and roasted aroma with much coffey.
Roasted malty taste that unfortunantly goes over and gets tart.
Big and nice body butlitle residual sweetness.
33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a big brown head.  Smells smoky and coffee. Tastes smoky, coffee and abit chocolate with a smoky coffee finish.

Limfjord är ett öl som bestiger ens inre högsta topp, pekar över landskapen och bort till horisonten, och säger: Allt härifrån och dit är mitt! Det är ingen mening att protestera eller stämma upp i klagosång, bara att med öppna armar välkomna Limfjord som den kung den är.

Bottle. Dark pour, light brown head. Interesting and pleasant aroma of smoke, tar, licorice, roasted malts. Medium sweet taste, a strange, harsh bitterness that puts me off a bit. Medium bodied, long finish, Im left with roasted malts and tar for quite a while in my mouth. This beer puzzles me...dont really know if I like it or not...
Black beer with a good sized brown head. Roasted and malty aroma. Good Smoky and roasted flavor.
En god öl från danmark som vi tyckte mycket om. Lättdrucken men inte så intressant.

Bottle. Black color, tan head. Roasted malt flavor with a dry finish. Full body, medium carbonation. Slightly disappointing, though by no means a bad beer. Serving temperature might have been a bit off, though.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2012 Bottle 33 cl, SB Nordstan. Pours pitch black with a small brown creamy head leaving lacing. Aroma is roasted, acidy, smokey, salty licorice, meaty and malty. Very nice indeed. Creamy velvety mouthfeel. Flavor is roasted, sweet, acidy, a bit fruity and has a very nice biterness. Finishes bitter sweet and roasted.

Tap at John Bull in Aalborg. 
Pours pitch black with a good creamy tanned head keaving lace. Aroma is heavy roasted malty smokey soy coffee and some dark chocolate. Flavor is like aroma, nicely fruity pears, heavy rich and well bitter, licorice, enjoyable. Finishes bitter roasted and a bit fruity.

Flaska köpt på SB 1/9. Rökig, bränd och söt doft som lovar mycket. Saknar typiska choklad och kaffedrag, istället brända rökiga toner och andra vaniljsöta. Kolsyrabubblig och lite vass munkänsla som balanseras av sötman. Fyllig på ett kärvt sätt. Bra, men jag blev nog ändå lite besviken.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Black liquid with big, thick tan head. Smells of smoke, dark chocolate, licorice, roasted malt, coffee and dark fruits. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with smoke, licorice and coffee. Medium bodied with OK carbonation and quite smooth mouthfeel. This beer has great balance and is really enjoyable. The smokiness makes it a bit special, in a good way.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget on September 1 and consumed on September 5. Pours a black liquid with a rather thin beige head. Carbonation is apparent with lots of small fizzy bubbles being visible in the glass. Smell is sweet and chocolaty with some hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty and with a touch of liquorice that quickly gives way for a pleasantly dry and bitter aftertaste filled with roasted malts, hops, chocolate and some metal.

330 ml bottle served in snifter. 2 finger mocca-colored head that sank to 3 mm. Black body with a tint of red. Nose: Smoked, coffee, licorice, italian sausage. Taste: Licorice, coffee, smoked,  licorice-root. Semi-dry ending with some hops presence.
Pours black with a large light brown head. Rich taste with smoke, licorice, coffee, bacon and a metallic note. More of the same in the equally rich taste with a lingering bitterness.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black color with a nice beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is roasted with coffee, chocolate and liquorice. Flavour is really roasted with dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice and some smoke. Body is full, texture is creamy to sticky, the carbonation is average. Bitter finish. Very nice beer!

Bottle 33cl. A black colour with a dark brown, creamy head. An aroma of smoked and roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and grass. The taste is sweet. A medium to full body, oily and thick texture, soft carbonation and a long finish. Will probably improve over time. Will keep one for later.

Flaska som jag lagrat under två år. Mörkt brun med moccafärgat skum. Doft av rostad malt och lite rökighet. Smaken är rundare än en icke lagrad flaska. Rökigheten inte lika framträdande. Kaffe, choklad och mörka bär. Trä och vanilj framträder mer än hos en icke lagrad flaska.

Pours a very dark brown, with tan head. Aroma is rich malt and slightly sweet with hints of licorice.. Taste is even better: Complex and rich, yet smooth. Dark fruits combine with malts and sugars to equal a very high quality brew. Thumbs way up on this one.

12 oz. bottle from Bruisin Ales.  Pours a clear dark brown color with a medium sized beige head.  The aroma has an interesting combination of smoke, char and wood with dark fruits, moderate sweetness, licorice and tobacco.  The flavor has big, but not overbearing smoked malts.  These are accompanied by dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, tobacco and wood.  There are very subtle notes of dark fruits and char.  This is another beer I have been wanting to try for a long time.  It did not disappoint.  I should have grabbed a couple more bottles.

labeled 01-07-09 consumed 1/9/11.
orange-red shade of dark brown  capped by a tan head.
smells sweet, smoky and ashy!....also, there are notes of roots/licorice sticks, wood, roast, molasses, a touch of coffee and some skunky hops.
the flavor is the same... malty but not exactly sweet, rich but not thick... well balanced.
it is medium bodied without veering into sugary... nice. 8/4/8/4/16
Tack till Peter (aka NordicV) för denna. Kolsvart mustig dryck, med gigantisk gräddig krona. Doftar mycket, doftar gott, doftar jul och nötter. Smaken - wow! En riktigt, riktigt bra öl.

Pitchblack with a lovely creamy cappuccino-colored head - quite sticky as well. Complex smoked and roasted aroma, notes of tar, chocolate, coffee, licorice and - I imagine - the windswept North Sea. The flavor is thick and powerful: Sweet, malty, medium bitter, smoky and a little salty. Medium to thick body. Long finish, thats soft like velvety and bitter like coffee at once. A very potent late-nite drink.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Bottle. Very dark brown - almost black, average to large and mostly lasting light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some roasted malt and light coffee with light hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and  lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, some roasted malt and light coffee, light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some roasted malt and light coffee, faint licorice and light hoppyness, faint alcohol. OK stout with roastiness. Not overly too sweet, bit one- dimensional. Could use more bitterness to balance coffee. Nice head though.
33cl, Danish brew, thx to MadsNP!, complex Porter, roasted and slightly smoked/spicy, not too heavy, very balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, One of Denmarks best-buys! (P/Q)

12oz bottle from once upon a vine southside. pours a rich, dark brown with a one-finger, creamy, khaki head leaving short, sticky rings of lace. aroma is great, interesting for sure, with heavy notes of campfire smoke, licorice, road tar, and wet leather backed by smoked bacon, cocoa, burnt coffee, and hints of pralines with subtle dark fruit notes as it warms. flavor is damn tasty as well with more heavy smoke, burnt grain, coffee grinds, and tobacco up front that settles out beneath notes of dark chocolate, molasses, and bittersweet licorice with subtle touches of dark fruit and ashy wood on the finish. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a lingering, dry, smokey finish. overall, a damn nice and very smokey baltic porter.

Whoa, character up the wazoo! I let the bottle warm up out of the fridge. Poured with a magnum sized foamy, frothy, fluffy, billowy, sudsy, tan head and lots of clingy lace. Color is an absolutely opaque black brown. Aroma is complex with licorice, dark ripe fruit, roast malt, earth, musty, old leather, gin, cocoa. Flavor is similar but also is quite dry with only a suggestion of possible sweetness if youre being good; plus a little salty tang, leftover coffee, unsweetened cocoa. Body is full, carbonation is spot on and the overall effect is just perfect for this beer. Finish is like flavor with the extremes diminishing first and softer components tapering later in a fairly lengthy process. Too big for a session, but what a work of art!

(33 cl bottle from SuperBrugsen) Pours pitch black with rich, long-lasting toffee head that laces the glass heavily. Complex, delicious aroma with notes of licorice, bacon and coffee. Suprisingly refined compared to Thisteds other offerings. Creamy on the palate, softly carbonated and full-bodied with a long, slightly bitter finish. Taste is well balanced, rich, with intense notes of licorice and a very slight bitterness. Girlfriend says "Very heavy on the bitterness."

Bottle from A Southern Season.  Pours black with thin light tan head. Nose is amazing: anise, burnt coffee, bacon grease, sweet coffee, milk sugars. Similar taste, but not as complex. A bit salty. Light, slick palate.

Total darkness poured from bottle with a smooth lightbrown head that lasts a long time. Aroma with hints of liqorice, leather and baba ghanousj. Looks great. Nice heavy but balanced taste with some salty edges. Quite thick espressolike texture, softly carbonated with an extended finish. I like this!

Bottle @ home, courtesy of camons. Huge thanks! Dark brown appearance with a dark brown head. Kind of a mild nutty, toasty brown malty nose. Creamy, roasty, toasty, a touch smoky, dark malty flavor. Smoky, roasty aftertaste. Pretty good beer. Thanks again, René!

Pour dark black with coffee brown head great lace. Aroma wow ridiculously layered, coffee, chocolate, smoke, vanilla, licorice, bacon, espresso, quite roasty. Taste salty, smoke, chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice, vanilla, sweet but very balanced, slightly creamy, bacon, roasty. MF medium to full creamy smooth body with light carb. Overall wow this beer rocks, a sensory overload all while being terrifically well balanced and super easy drinking very well done.

Leicht süßer Antrunk, etwas an Rauchbier erinnernd (Schinken), fruchtig-malzig werdend. Hierbei nimmt das Malz eine vorherrschende Stellung ein und wird schnell intensiver, bleibt dabei aber immer harmonisch, leicht süßlich und sehr cremig. Dunkel, mittelwürzig, das Bier wird deutlich röstig, ohne dabei die genannten Attribute zu verlieren. Hier nun deutlich würziger, bekömmlich, sehr intensiv! Auch hier ist die leichte Rauchigkeit präsent und peppt das Ganze noch weiter auf. Leicht erdig, zum Ende hin in angenehmen Maßen bitter werdend, das extrem voluminöse Malz ist weiter führend. Ein absolutes Spitzenprodukt!! 	 
Test vom 30.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,14,14,15,-,14 - 13,94

Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a creamy tan head, leaving nice lacings. Aroma of raosted malt, light smoke, licorice. Taste is hard roasted malt, coffee, english licorice, some smoke, notes of dark bitter chocolate. Full body, nice quite high level of carbonation. Very nice Baltic porter, and allthough brewed by a macro brewery stands heads and shoulders to most microbrews. By far the best value for money beer to be bought in Denmark. 290511

25th May 2009Opaque black beer. Smooth palate, frothy in the mouth. Roasty malt that manages to stay the right side of being dry and bitter. Smooth minerally finish with a little carbonated sting. Gets a little sweeter towards the end.
Bottle. Pours black, with a thick, reddish creamy head. A smokey, sea front aroma with notes of tar, coffee and liquorice. Flavour is burned malt, smoke and coffee, giving a dry burned finish.

Wow this is smokey! Heavy thick oily smoked aroma. Very pervasive. Thick and black but woefully short on foam and bubbles. Malt and smooth and sweet on your tounge, it goes out just as smooth and fades out slowly and quietly. With just a bit of CO2 this would be stellar.

Pours an opaque black with a big very light brown head that leaves sheets of lace on the snifter I am drinking it from. The aroma is smoky and has some bonfire-like qualities, this mixes surprisingly well with the rich aromas of dark fruit, brown sugar, and light cocoa. The flavor is significantly smoky, and right up front that is the thing that stands out as the dominant flavor, but the beer rounds out nicely with roasty coffee like bitterness, dark fruit, and mild molasses. This has to be one of the driest baltic porters Ive ever tried which makes it of course all the more glorious. The mouthfeel is full and rich, the carbonation is a little high but thats really not something I would complain about. 
Superb.

Bottle from Star Grocery, Berkeley. Pours dark brown wit a thin but attractive light brown head and a licorice aroma. There is a very smoky malt flavor that is not a bit sweet, but rather dry with plenty of treacle and licorice. This is an unusual but very tasty porter.

fine grey head, lasting. black-black-black.
dark roasted nose, chocolate, cofee, great nose in a dryish way.
Dry, chocolate, burnt cofee, some length, and bitternes - but maiinly from the dark malts.
is it to young? it seems a bit unevolved and hard.

Bottle. Deep opaque brown/black body, thick, clumping, dense light brown head. Dry, smoky nose with abundant soy, in addition to sawed wood and licorice. Dry body, smoky and salty with notes of squid ink, licorice, and bacon. An interesting beer, meaty and rich with modest complexity.
Bottle. Pours a black beer with a dark beige head. The aroma is malt, roasted, smoke and peat. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is smoke and roasted notes. Overall a good and complex beer.
Chocolate in the aroma, malty and rather dry in the taste, the alcohol is a little noticeable.  Pretty good.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours black with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

I had this on tap in Copenhagen, a local favorite that I had to try.

Pours dark brown with a light tan head, great lacing, super foamy and creamy...The taste is coffee with light nuttyness, quite insteresting, but weird. Light fell but its super easy to drink.

This isnt stunning but unique enough to give it a shot, super easy to drink stout.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoke, bacon, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, smoke, chocolate, coffee and alcohol.
Pours dark brown with small off white head. The aroma has plum, chalk, licorice and a hint of coffee. The flavor has candy, chalk, licorice, salt and coffee.

Pours black with a very thin head. Very bold aroma. Banana,,dark Malta very nice. Wow very strong and very bold. This s a very nice Baltic porter . This is great. One hell of a Baltic porter.  Very spicy and complex.

Bottle. Pours opaque black, thin pale tan head, spotty lacing. Nose is bananas, spice, big deep fudgy roast, with plenty of caramel and chocolate. Smells like a banana dipped in chocolate syrup and topped with vanilla ice cream! Nice notes of smoke, creosote, tar, toast. Very oily and smoky in the mouth, with a tar-dipped banana flavour, quite balanced, with a long, lingering finish. I groove on this!

I bought the beer in a local supermarket (Super Brugsen), and the price was only 9 kr, which is around 1 euro. pr. 33 cl. bottle. I love porters and stouts, but didnt have high expectations. However:

The beer looks really good. It has a nice head, which fades pretty fast (typically "bottlestyle"). 

The foam is beige and has a very intense smokey scent. 

The dark, almost black beer (not good lighting conditions) looks great. 

The taste is awesome. The carbon-stingyness is pretty noticeble, almost like a lager. The beer is easy to get down, yet very intense. Almost salty - liqourice, smoke and hops. The taste is fresh at first, then evolves into the smokey, spicey tones, and after the shochwave has settlet it slowly fades out but stays with you for at least 10 minutes. 
This beer has personality, it is not anonymous, and would be easy to distinguish from fellow porters. It can be explored, let me put it like that. 

All in all a very good beer, especially compared to the price. I can do nothing but recommend it. Even if it doesnt fall in your taste it is well worth the money.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2011 Bottle from Danish supermarket.
Black with a creamy cappuccino to light brown head leaving lacing.
Aroma: peaty, chocolate, licorice.
Taste: heavily roasted, coffee, licorice, peat, chocolate, some smoked meat.
Quite a full body, smooth.
At 10-11 DKK this is great value for money.

11.5 ounce bottle. 

Pours into my snifter a thick dark black with hints of ruby towards the edges. The head is large and thick, it is a dark tan.

The nose is quite strong. There are hints of licorice, smoke, roasted malts, chocolate and a pinch of coffee.

The flavors follows the taste with thick malty flavors of coffee, roasted malt, hint of licorice, some fruitiness, cocoa, and a hit of sugar. The alcohol is pretty unnoticeable. The mouthfeel is thick and lightly carbonated.

This is a very good beer. It is highly unique for the baltic porter style, it is more of an american styled porter. It is sweet and decadent but perhaps not so much as the common baltic porter. But it is a nice balanced imperial style porter worth picking up.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-12-2010 01:11:34

0,33 l. bottle from Irma-supermarket. Very dark brown colour, with a thick tan head. Impressive malt aroma, with smoke, vanilla and coffee. Long lasting laceing. Medium body and bitterness from the burnt malt, oliy texture. Finish is long and pleasent. Excellent price - taste ratio, at just 10 DDK/1,30 EUR this is a really good deal - better than 4 times more expensive beers. Bravo Thy Brewhouse!
Traditional baltic porter, good roasted flavors, easy drinkabililty, medium heavy body

(330 ml bottle from Downeast Beverage, cellared for 10 mos. after purchase) Pours very dark brown with just a thin biege head that mostly disappears. Aroma of molasses, dark fruits, cocoa/chocolate and licorice. Mouthfeel is a little dry, a little thin and a little fizzy. Flavor carries all elements of the aroma, dominated by cocoa/chocolate, raisin and light molasses, which nicely intertwine. Finishes a little hot but overall the ABV is nicely integrated. As good as this is, you might wish it was a little beefier (like say, an Americanized imp. stout) but this beer remains very true to style.
Bottle. Dark dark brown with a light espresso hed. Smells of smoke and coffee. Oily feel in mouth. Massive taste if smoke, chocolate and coffee. Almost some ashtray feel. Good bitter finish

0.33l bottle. Limfjord Porter pours a near black heavy body with a quickly fading quite brown head leaving big lacings. Aromas are strong of roasted, almost smoked malts, lots of cofee, some licorice and bittersweet chocolate. Quite a strong and powerful nose if I may say. Medium to perfectly carbonated and full-bodied. Nice strong chocolate flavors and lots of long lasting roasted malts. There is also a saltish tone dancing in the background that I really like and the this is really helping lifting the chocolate flavors.  Fizzing in the throat. A nice sipper. There is also a tiny hint of alcohol. Really nice. Medium bitterness finish that lasts for quite a time.
Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is smoked, burnt, hard roasted malt and a little liquorice. Flavor is rather sweet and light bitter, and the body is full. Thick, soft and smooth. 060111

50 cl bottle, Copenhagen, Denmark. Deep chalk-brown, coffee, black liquorice and dark chocolate aroma. Thick, inky and intense, a bitterness and celery on the first sip. Finishes sweet and warming. Amazing for a $1 bottle on the bottom shelf of a Danish grocery store.
Almost black color.  Aroma of roast, molasses, carob, brown sugar and coffee.  Great roasty flavor, licorice, molasses, chocolate...great stuff!
Deep brown pour with a small head.  Smoky roasty aroma.  Nicebig smoky flavor with a bit of dark fruit.  Very tasty!
Black pour with tan head, sweet caramel malt aroma.  Taste is sweet with a little roasted malt, not much bitterness.  A decent porter.
Lovely beer, dark and thick with flavors of tar and licorice, dark brown foam. generally just a super yummy beer ...

Meget mørk brun til sort farve med brunt hoved. Virker sødelig i sin aroma, noter af hård ristet malt og lakrids. Smagen er meget roasty og brændt, men virker behagelig sød med en lang røget og brændt fornemmelse. En tør og behagelig let bitter eftersmag. DK-B-29,25
BLack body, brown head. Roasted caramel, some chocolate and ash. Balanced bitterness, dark malty notes. Sweet and not too heavy.

Bottle. Poured a black color with a minimal light brown head that was mostly lasting with fair lacing. Good roasted coffee, licorice and chocolate aroma. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and flat carbonation. Well balanced sweet toasted malt flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Very good porter.

Pours a dark color with a very thin soapy head.  Has an aroma of roast and chocolate with hints of dark fruit and caramel.  Has a sweet roasty taste with a subdued bitterness and a nice velvety chocolate finish.  Thin to medium mouthfeel.  This is an excellent BP.  Up there with the Duck Rabbit.

Very dark with a funky tan head that lasted nicely.  Aroma is also funky with ash, wood, and hops.  Flavor was similar and was fairly robust.  Dark chocolate and a bit of licorice.  I had concerns early with this one but its came through nicely.
Nose of hazel, port, plums, and late alcohol and vanilla. Broad feel, balanced medium carb. Taste is roasted malt, licorice, coffee, and late sweets

Limfjords Porter (Double Brown Stout) is a pitch black liquid with a huge, soft, bistre colored head that has outstanding retention and lacing.  Its a unique look.  It has a huge aroma of smoke and ash.  It smells like a camp fire.  Its medium bodied and a bit metallic.  The finish is a bit watery and it leaves the tongue dry and a bit numb.  It tastes like it smells: smoke and ash.  Theres a hint of licorice sweetness at the finish.  The aftertaste has a lingering bitterness like baking chocolate.  The bottle didnt say anything about smoke.  In a blind tasting, Id probably guess this as a smoked Baltic porter.  Its very unique.

330ml bottle shared by footbalm, thanks 
Appearance: Poured dark brown with a medium sized beige head and some lacing left in the glass 
Aroma: Chocolate, smoke and coffee 
Taste: Roasted malts, smokey, spices and chocolate 
Nice.

bottle. dark brown, almost black pour with brown head. aroma of roasted malt, nuts, burnt marshmallow, and toast. flavor of a nutty, foreign stout or baltic porter. dry roasted and cocoa everywhere..thin body, but works well with the style. excellent

Bottle shared by footbalm. Pours a totally black color with a medium creamy tan head. The aroma is smoky, spicy licorice, chocolates, earthy. The flavor is dominated by smoke and spicy licorice, some earthy chocolates and sweet milkiness. Nice though Im not a huge licorice fan.
thanks secret santa! Dark creamy molasses nose, jet brown with a whipped tan head. strong toasty character, mellows a bit to a creamier body, finishes coffee forward

Bottle. Pours very dark with big beige head. Strong aroma. Theres a bit too much licorice for my tastes. Chocolate malt and some roastiness come through, as well some booze. With all that richness, it still pulls back to finish dry. Lots of flavors, but again, too much licorice.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Black color, big light brown head. Malty taste with smoke and earthly hops. Taste of roasted malt, coffee, grass. Very nice bitter finish

(bottle, 33cl) Black coloured hue with a beige medium-sized foamy head. Roasty and slightly smoke-malty aroma with notes of chocolate and mocha, accompanied by a touch of barnyard. Roasty bitter and moderately sweet flavour, full bodied with an almost creamy mouthfeel. Complex and robust malty base with roasted and smoked malt, subtle fruity accents of blueberries, as well as chocolate and coffee; moderately bitter-sweet and delicately smokey finish. Wonderful Porter. 07.V.07

In short: A superb smoky chocolaty black beer with a pleasant unexpected rustic twist.  Great stuff.
How: Bottle 330ml.  A few times.  This rating for a relatively fresh bottle (4 months after purchase) sent to me by HogtownHarry.  Thanks a lot Harry
The look: Black body topped by a medium beige head
In long: The nose is superb on this one.  Some kind of smoky chocolate cake aroma.  Taste is black cake malts (very cake), milk chocolate, some red apples, smoke, cacao, coconut, caramel, green grass.  The roastiness level is in the medium-high range and it makes the beer feel quite dry although I could sense that it is actually quite sweet.  A little tartness.  Something pleasantly strange about the yeast signature here, almost feels like a rustic Saison yeast. Body is full and the carbonation is a bit aggressive which lightens the beer out.  This is scarily easy to drink.  Id go as far as to say that this is very much sessionnable.  An outstanding black beer (smoked? stout? porter? whatever).  I drank this beer while watching Dancing With The Stars on my iPad, wearing my designer Gucci shoes and my tight purple shirt.  And you cannot even punch me because Im on the internet.

Bottle from Half Time. Pours very black with a 3 finger dark tan head. Anise aroma is everywhere. Lots of chocolate in the nose. Full bodied with very creamy/frothy carbonation. The anise flavor is very strong. Theres some sweet dark burnt malt, but the anise tends to dominate. Does. Finishes balanced - sweet/bitter-burnt - maybe even hop. Like lots of floral hop? Really, really good.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 You can really taste the licorice (which I dont like licorice  but the rest of the beer made up for it).  Quite good for what it is but not really my thing. Serving: Bottle

Bottle c:\ Papsoe I think. Been sitting on this for a while now. Rich aroma - like an aged leather jacket. Tobacco in there also. Palate built on rich dark malts - subtle and well blended. The leather aroma comes in to the flavours also. Rich, complex and very well crafted
Black with creamy head. Aroma coffee, roasted malt, tar. Taste as aroma. Full body, smooth, thick. Finish slight bitter, long roasted taste
Bottle. Black and clear with a thick lasting head. Aroma of salt, violet and metal. Hints of smoke and roast. The taste is dry and salt with a bitter finish. Full body.

Pours a three finger light tan head that fades slowly to a thin layer, leaving some lace. Black color, no highlights. Light-medium carbonation and heavy bodied. Smoke/licorice nose. Flavor is smoke and unsweetened licorice. Dry finish.  Not the typical Baltic porter. Expensive at $7.95 for a 330ml bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, Ma.

330ml bottle shared with blankboy and biegaman.  Black pour, light brown diminishing head.  Funky aroma, lemon juice, licorice, burnt molasses, booze, green apple  ...  Taste - again, lemon juice - is this old?  hard to tell - deep roast, dry coffee grounds, alcohol, sour green fruit - ehhh.  Slick, boozy, syrupy, acidic - tasty, funky, and it gets better as your palate adjusts to the sourness.  May have to re-rate one day.

Bottle - thanks Cletus.  Pours a immensely dark brown with a thin, creamy brown head.  Nose is slightly sour at first before a heavy roasty and smokey vibe.  I get a little sweetness in the taste, some wood, roast, and lot of campfire.  Silky mouthful.  Different than expected, but nice.

imfjordporter från Thisted Bryghus är en mycket tjock och rökig porter. Stora inslag av salt serranoskinka.
Vätskan är fyllig och eftermaken er fint balanserad.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, licorice, slight smoke, and that kind of generic Baltic Porter scent.  Poured pitch black in color with a small, creamy, dense, brown head that lasted throughout.  Opaque.  Sparkling.  Good lacing.  Flavor is medium sweet, slightly bitter, and slightly acetic.  Tastes of malt, roasting, light smoke, light tar, wood, and slight chocolate.  Medium body.  Slightly thin, lightly dry texture.  Soft carbonation.  Roasted malt, smoke, tar, and wood finish is lightly dry.  7.9%ABV is not detectable.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Pours Brown/black with a nice brown head. Aroma of Roasted Coffee, smoked meat, Licorice, chocolate, Brown sugar, roasted malts and a bit of hops. Taste has those same awesome notes. Limfjordsporter just brings it every time!  Nice mouthfeel asswell! Dont get fooled by the price of this one!
thick feel, full body, licorice, black, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

Bottle. Pours a thick looking very dark brown with a steady brown head. Sweet aromas of chocolate liqueur, prunes, leather. sweet flavours of chocolate, raisins/prunes, dark toffee, cherries, vanilla, and cigar box. Very port-like in my mind. Rich smooth mouthfeel. Very flavourful and drinkable, whereas I find some baltic porters can become a little too sweet, this one seemed to strike the right balance for me.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
From the Bottle at TAP 1, Copenhagen 07/05/2010
Coffee roast aroma. Beige head. Black a little rich on the palate and strong in alcohol with a little dryness in a fruity and slightly grainy roast finish.

330ml Bottle (Jernbanecafeen, Copenhagen and a bottle from Faroeviking, thanks) - Black with a tan head. Roasted aroma with coffee and plain chocolate. Roasted taste with malt, coffee and bournville chocolate.

Pours a very dark brown, nearly black colour, but allows for a faint reddish shine, along the edges. Half a finger of dark, creamy foam. Aroma has hints of burnt and smoked malts, dark chocolate, along with a rather faint sweetness. Taste of well-roasted malts, smoke, dark chocolate, some caramel along with hints of coffee and some hops. Fairly long duration, high, albeit quickly diminishing, carbonation, medium body. Fantastic taste in a very affordable beer. Very recommendable.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Deep brown, almost black pour with a frothy brown head, leaving some lacing. Aroma has smoke, roast, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, a bit of sweetness, and some hops. Very soothing yet rather complex aroma. Taste is heavily roasted, roasted bitterness, smoke, coffee, licorice, a bit of hops. Coffee and hops in the after taste. Medium bodied, high carbonation (a bit too high, but just right after a couple of swirls) and a medium duration. The best cheap beer in Denmark. We are proud of the Limfjordsporter.   Vintage 1989. When it just got free of the bottle, it had a strong basement and mushroom aroma - but after 5-10 minutes it evaporated off, leaving space for a more nuanced malt profile - hard roasted, chocolate, heavy umami nose, cherries, vanilla, amazing aroma, no oxidation at all. Tastes really umami, hard roast, soy sauce, chocolate, a hint of oxidation, unroasted cocoa beans. I cant believe how well this has held up. 1,000,000,000 thanks to Svend for sharing this. 9-4-8-3-17

Bottle from KIHOSKH.

This is probably one of the best value for money deeals you can get!

Lots of rosted malts, chocolate and some cream

(Old BA rate - tap)
Nearing jet black in color, and poured with a generous finger length of a thick creamy light tan head. Roasted, chocolatey malt, and a hint of sweetness and a little smokey. Definite roasted characteristics, and very bitter chocolate flavors (not quite bittersweet) Medium to creamy MF, nice touch of carbonation. Pretty solid drinkability given the richness. Ive had more interesting in the style, but this is solid drinking and easy to sip. Good brew

I remember enjoying this for the most part, mainly intrigued for purchase through the mention of licorice.  Well, the licorice definitely came through in a pleasantly light way, and that was that.  Would probably buy again if I saw it.

Bottle with friends, 2010-05-02, Göteborg
AP:  black body with creamy nougat brown high creamy head
AR: liquorice, young Islay whiskey, chocolate, coffey
F: rough Islay whiskey barrel, sweet liquorice, port wine, bitter chocolate, Zoega coffey, aaa a good porter (stout) - a must buy!
Pitch black like the deepest bowels of hell. Lightly spiced with black licorice. Pleasant. Nice overall offering. Rated 7/16/09

This is another classic brew from my baby steps into craft beer, and another specimen of very good beer we Norwegians are blessed to have readily available in abundance through our state-sponsored alcohol monopoly system. Limfjords Porter pours a almost-black body with a creamy, thin caramel head. Smell is licorice, leather, smoke and soy sauce. Taste is coffee, burnt malts, sweet licorice, salt and leather notes in the background. Ive never actually tasted leather, so I sometimes feel a bit stupid using it as a taste reference - but its the closest thing I get. This is a good beer: straight forward enough and yet kinda complex. I definitely like the bittersweet/salt coffee/licorice-combo, which really rings my bell. A choice Baltic porter.

This poured a very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma was very dark roasted malt, some coffee and some caramel notes. Flavor was very roasted and burnt, not much sweetness at all. Overall an above par porter.

Pours black with a tan head. Very nice flavors of coffee, smoke and a bit of dark chocolate. Has just a hint of sourness, otherwise dry and with low bitterness. Very tasty and cheap baltic porter. I would probably buy this a lot if I lived in Denmark.

11.2 oz bottle. This one poured a very deep, and thick brown with a nice layer of brown cream head that leaves a decent amount of lacing. Definitely a pretty, yet fairly mean looking porter. Licorice is definitely evident in the aroma, as the herbal liquor notes are hard to miss. Smoked wood and light ham are also there, as well as some malted black grains, light peppery spices, and some earth. With an aroma like that, you would normally expect some fairly intense flavors, but the opposite is the case here. This a very smooth, and mellow tasting beer for the most part. There is just the slightest twinge of booze right in the finish. Herbal liquor and smoked grains do play a part, but not nearly as big as in the aroma as the malt mostly take over. Dark malted grains, bittersweet fruit candy, mellow earth, and also some slightly funky peppercorn notes. Overall, this was a tasty and drinkable baltic porter with some nice unique qualities and complexities.
Definitely the best low price beer available in Denmark. Baltic porter with a remarkable complexity for a beer in this price range.

33cL bottle pours an opaque black with 1.5 finger lasting, sticky, lacy tan head.  Aroma is somewhat muted by the foam, but cocoa, campfire smoke, and (?)grape(?) come through in wafts.  Taste is interesting, smoky, earthy flavors abound.  Almost like a peat/chocolate mixture in the middle, then fading to dark chocolate at the end.  Smooth and creamy with just a touch of oiliness.  No hint of the ABV, hidden extremely well.

From tap at Tusindfryd Aalborg. Colour is black with a tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, smoked malts, coffee and chocolate.  Flavour is somewhat bitter. Tastes like a very black and very roasted coffee, some very roasted malts, liquorice and some chocolate. Nice full body, with and oily thick mouthfeel. Overall a great Baltic Porter, that is extremly cheap!

33cL Bottle, purchased at Nikkis Liquors - Providence, RI. Interesting musky chocolate, spice, and rustic woodsy aroma. Kind of musty, earthy, and cellar-like in a damp, cold, rock-wall kind of way. Pours a nice even milk chocolate brown, with copious and well-lacing hot chocolate-colored head. Flavor throws up some immediate pilsner-malt-mineral tanginess, a bit of alcohol, then a soft bread and buttery malt sugar that kind of sways back and forth between brown sugar, molasses, and brandy. Very enjoyable and not dissimilar from Bells Kalamazoo Stout. Sails out on a noticeable and fresh clean hop bitterness.
mørk maltet,smoke, brown foam, black, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter, long finish, nice beer.

Bottle. Pours darkbrown/black with a creamy one finger tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, licorice and some spices. Flavor was smooth and roasty with bittersweet chocolate, roasted malts, licorice, dark fruit and some subtle smokiness with a dry and bitter coffee finish

2 bouteilles de 330 ml partagées lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez MartinT. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat et de de fumée avec une pointe dépices. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat et de torréfaction avec une pointe de caramel et dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement torréfié. (Rating #2864)

Pours very nice dark black with good head and nice lacing.  Nose is very strong smokiness with slight chocolate notes.  The aroma is more moderate but still dominated by smoked meat, but not in an overpowering way.  Its actually really tasty.  No bitterness, which is awesome for the style IMO.  Kinda reminds me of a less sweet, meaty Tootsie Roll, which is good by me.

Lived in DK and this was the best Danish beer.  Tastes of coffee, smoke.  Real deep flavor but not heavy.  When poured from a bottle, can generate a nice frothy head.  

My favorite Porter.

Bottle at the Winking Lizard Crosswoods. Darkest brown/black pour with a thick tan head. Roasty aroma with chocolate and a bit of metallic character. Roasty chocolate flavor with a bit of dark fruit and a bitter coffee finish. Very tasty, but be careful. A friend of mine ordered this right after me and his bottle was infected.

16.01.2010, 0,33l Bottle. Dark brown, almost black colour with tan head. Rich malty aroma with smooth tender bitterness. Roasted dark malt with a lot of taste. Bitterness is vell balanced with the richness. Aftertaste is roasted, dry and bitter. A very good Porter.

Rating #1000.  Black with a deep beige head.  Roasted malts, licorice, molasses, pepper, spices, cocoa, milk in the aroma.  Syrupy slow mouth.  Powerful roasted malts, dark, bittersweet chocolate, molasses, licorice, light pepper, spices, burnt malts.  Finishes with bitter burnt malt and some molasses.  A very full porter and a beer Im glad I picked for 1000.

Bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours pitch black like engine oil with a big tan head. Aroma: Liquorice, spice, chocolate, alcohol, malt, quite creamy with some oak there. Taste: Huge oak-ness to it, lots of liquorice, alcohol, almost chewy, brandy, red wine, long wood barrel aged whiskey finish. Nice.

great brew. thanks to SoLan for the recommendation! .. . medium smokiness, damn, so smooth .. . danish goodness .. dark black! .. . some licorice in the back.. man, wheres the bbq to go with this! .. . a class act! .. . i wear 2 belts, just in case i got beat someone and run at the same time!

Bottle shared with Radek Kliber, frylock, garthicus & rudolf -- c/o swoopjones. Pours an impenetrable black with a nice frothy tan head. Nice lacing. Great aroma of chocolate, coffee, toffee, alcohol, licorice, spices and more -- quite complex, theres lots there. Flavour, also great, of lightly burnt roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice, oak, alcohol, dark fruit, a hint of smoke and more -- again, like the aroma, more and more flavours reveal themselves as you drink it. Nice, long sweet finish. Slightly creamy mouthfeel. Simply fantastic, what a beer!

Holy crap is this smoky! Like a rochbier, but done to a baltic porter. There is some sweetness in here, but its hard to find amidst the bacon flavor. The smell is nowhere near as potent as the flavor, so it really caught me off guard. Pour looks like a pitch black sludge, like Im pouring a Ten Fidy. Head quickly dissolves. Bottle from Knightly Spirits in Orlando.

Very tasty beer. Some coffee, some smoke, some spice, some sweetness. Label says made with liquorice, but thats not strongly apparent. Pours a deep dark brown with thin to no head. Aroma is very enticing and theres a nice smoky finish.
Aroma caramel, bread, basement aromas, brown, black, cloudy, brown foam, very bitter, medium sweetness, average carbonation, bitter, medium body, oily feel,

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2010 Re-reviewing this as a second bottle is much more enjoyable when served at a warmer temperature.  Pours very dark brown, medium thickness, with a good tan head that leaves a foamy cap and a lot of nice lacing.  Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruits, some light sourness or is that soy sauce?  Licorice is plentiful, some chocolate, coffee, a bit of smoke.  Flavor is roasted malts, licorice, chocolate, coffee, somewhat acidic and astringent on the finish, more so toward the bottom of the glass.  Mouthfeel is full, creamy, with a fair amount of prickly carbonation.  While still no Sinebrychoff, this does benefit from a warmer serving temp like the Koff does.  Much better this second time around.
Original review Dec 17, 2009.
Pours dark brown with a small beige head that reduces to a ring.  Tiny bit of lacing.  Aroma is licorice, roasted malt, light coffee, light smoke.  Flavor is more licorice, a little chocolate and coffee.  Finish picks up some smoked meat notes as I work down the glass.  Body is on the thin side, low carbonation.  OK.  Middle-of-the-road for baltic porters which are one of my favorite styles.
Overall: 3.3

04-DEC-2009, bottle, Ulkløbben @Michael.
Bery dark brown, light brown head.
A bit dull nose. Very roasted, liqourice, tar, smoke, burned asphalt. Slightly bitter hoppy ending and a little thin.
Complex and not a beginners porter. Very nice.
A favorite. Dark, almost black. Nice bitterness. Licorice notes and just a tiny hint of some salt (from the Northsea close by?).

Thanks to SwoopJones. Appearance: Pitch black, motor oil, tan head. Aroma: Liquorice, spice, chocolate, alcohol, malt, quite creamy with some oak there. Flavour: Huge oak-ness to it, lots of liquorice, alcohol, almost chewy, brandy, red wine, long wood barrel aged whiskey finish.

Bottle. Black color with a good looking light brown head. 

Smoky aroma with hints of ham, or perhaps smoked salmon. A lot of  licorice and saltiness in the taste also coffee and bitter chocolate. Aftertaste was a little on the sweet side. A good porter, easy to drink.

I think this one was from badge ben.  I might have a second rating from an overseas trade that was from a good bottle, but this rating came from a bottle that had issues to say the least.  Smelled like a wisconsin dairy farm - hay and cow manure on the aroma.  A similar taste, but with coffee tastes.

Tried this one quite a few years ago and thought it was extreme. Now I find it a delight in small doses. Black pour topped by a beutiful creamy light brown head that lasts. Aroma of Tar, Smoke, Roasted malt, hints of coffe, and choclate. Lightl bitterness troughout the drink. Starts also slightly acidic but becomes more salty and alcoholic towards the end. Its powerful but balanced. Medium to full bodied, the texture is creamy and a bit dry with soft carbonation. Leaves a lasting impression and is certainly recommended.
Bottle pours black with reddish edges. Coffee, smoke and licorice. Flavor is smoky malt, a little coffee and chocolate with licorice notes in the finish.

Shared with Radek, Frylock, Garthicus and Blankboy - thanks to Swoopjones for the bottle.  Black, nice tan head.  Nose is coffee, rich toffee, a bit of alcohol & spice.  Flavor is huge roast, a bit burnt, honey, rich rich malt.  Lingering sweet finish.
Bottle. Smoked licorice! Do I need to say any more? Coffee. This is an easy to drink, yet complex porter.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a huge tan head that lasts a good ten minuets into this lovely beer. As I type there is still a thick layer of tan foam covering the beer, also leaves some awesome lace.
Aroma is peated malt smokiness over chocolate. Flavor is smoky peated malt, chocolate, coffee and some raisin in the mix. The black licorice really comes through in the finish, along with bitter chocolate. Very creamy mouth feel, this would go great with chocolate cake. Wow! This was a huge surprise to say the least, Id heard to was great but this one lives up to the hype, and only $4.99 a bottle. Better stock up.

What can I say, its distinctive and delicious.  There is a strong smoked-meat character here, I wont say bacon, thats just too easy.  More like smoked salmon.  Smoked salmon in a bottle.  Yum.  Now thats good beer.
Bottle. Tasty beer!!!  Pours dark borwn with tan head. Nose of peaty yeast. Thicky body, and continued peaty, smokey cinammon, and  roastey notes. Finisih slightly bitter, but clean.

11.2oz bottle with 01/07/09 stamped on the front label. Pours a deep brown, almost black body with a finger-width, brown, creamy head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of succulent lacing. Gorgeous with great retention. Aroma is strong smoked malts that are a bit meaty with plenty of bittersweet dark chocolates. Licorice and burnt raisin sweetness accompany the creamy chocolates more and more as this warms. Flavor is sweetly smoked with lots of bittersweet dark chocolates and a bit of ash. More of the licorice and burnt raisin comes in before this finishes with an even mix of smoke and creamy chocolate. Dry and slightly metallic with a medium length aftertaste with the smoked malts sticking out the most. Medium bodied and smooth with just a touch of carbonation. Overall, a delicious Baltic Porter. Not the most complex, but well put together and well balanced. Very impressed.

330 ml bottle - dense, dark brown pour with 1/2" thick tan head settling slowly; rich aromas of coffee, licorice, peaty roast, creamy chocolate; texture is on the rich side with silky sweetness; bitter coffee at first sip with a dry, almost smoky flavor; wow, quite the flavor mix with lots of coffee, bitter chocolate and slight smoke notes; plenty of oaty sweetness; great stuff even though a little thicker than youd expect, a true standout in the style

Pours with a dark brown to black body topped by a medium thick to thick head with some lacing.  Its slightly sweet and malty with a smokey, peaty note, notes of licorice and a slight bitterness.  Full bodied, smooth and slightly warming.

330 ml bottle. From København, Denmark.
Pitch black colour with small brown creamy head. Roasted malt, dark cacao, chocolate and coffee in aroma. Roasted malt, coffee, dark cacao, some warming alcohol and bitter hoppiness in flavour. Great balanced Porter. Just a pinch too much of coffee for my taste.

Nice deep dark brown coloured body with a thick, two centimetre tall light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, pit fruits, raisins and a trace of fennel seed. Medium-bodied; Roasty flavour up front with a good pit fruit taste coupled with coffee and burnt sugars. Aftertaste shows a lot of malt, roasty and toasted oats, alcohol and quite a bit of anise and fennel tastes. Overall, a deep and strong (read roasty) baltic porter that shows well, but still isnt as good as others, such as Zywiec, at least to me. I sampled this 33 cL bottle purchased from Liquor Outlet in Boonton, New Jersey on 03-October-2009, sampled at home in Washington on 15-October-2009.

Bottle via Mys Wap 4.0 (thanks dkachur!). Pours black with grey highlights (is that a contradiction?) and a way chunky tan head. Nose is awesome, chcolate, licorice and coffee. Taste starts with chocolate, then some coffee, some licorice and anise, some more chocolate and a LONG lingering coffee/cacao finish that is absolutely divine. I swear i taste some plums and raisins in that finish, as well as some oats and lactose. Damn there is hardly a dark beer flavor i do NOT taste in this divine brew...even some subtle smokiness...!! Bravo to Thisted Bryghus, this is a stellar world class beer.
bottle, dark brown with big chocolate fast receding foam, good aroma of cocoa and spice, flavors of cinammon, bakers chocolate, roasted malt, nice beer

Botte from Premier Gourmet. Dated 1/07/2009. Pours a opaque black body with a small tan head. Decent lacing. Aroma is full of roasted malts, mocha, red wine and some smoky notes. Flavor is very roasted malts with some vanilla and coffee. Smooth, dry, medium bodied. Very bitter. Alcohol is hidden well. Good baltic porter.

0,33 bottle, nice spongylike off brown (quite dark ) head, body is very dark (almost black), aroma is roasiness, malts, whiskey barrel, taste is what I like, smooth, rather heavy bodied, syrup, roasted malts, chocolate , it is a thick beer with this milk-ish/egg-ish  consistency, nice with a chocolate dessert, and the brewer even gives 5 different ways of serving it on the back label
Pours black with a thick tan head. Aroma is maple, malt, and a slight roasted coffee. Nice malty flavor with some coffee. Good mouthfeel and hoppiness without being over-bearing. Good finish.

Got in my secret santa package. Pours pretty dark not pitch black though with a small head. Aroma was roasty, chocolate and some spices and maybe a little smoke. Flavor was roasty and pretty smooth. Really nice palate on this one even thought the body is not to big. Tastey beer.

Bottle  Deep, black body.  Brown, frothy/creamy head.  Aroma of coffee, port, red grapes, red wine, wood ... very nice and subtle.  Moderately bitter, lightly sweet flavour.  Not bad, but rather normal flavour.  Aroma is much better than the flavour.

01.07.09 dated bottle. Pours black with thin mahogany highlights when held to light and a creamy, 1 finger tan head that fades to a thick skim and ring fairly quick and holds there, leaving some parse lacing. Aroma is roast, bitter chocolate, smoke, burning wet leaves, leathery tannin notes, and some slight basement and wet forest funk. More vinous qualities come out as it warms. Flavor is roast, smoke, oak, dry licorice notes, char, some dried dark fruit notes, bittersweet chocolate and what seems like an errant pine note near the finish. Finishes roast, char, wet leaves, charred wood, bitter hops, and bitter dark chocolate. Palate is medium bodied, dry throughout, with a light-yet pretty sharp carbonation and a dry, bordering on astringent finish. This stuff took a bit to grow on me, not so much that it improves as it warms, but that I really had to get my head around what was going on here. This is a very interesting brew, it reminds me of a good aged porter or stout gone right, still I found some aromas and flavors to be a little at odds with me loving this brew to death. Certainly I am picking nits here, as this is a fantastic brew, that just made it all the more frustrating as I think with a little more sweetness and a little less tannins(?) and astringency this could be mindblowing. I will definitely have to pick this up again when I can.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2012 On draft at the new Pizzeria Paradiso in Dupont Circle, the recommended finishing beer from Greg the beer manager.  Very black, with a brown head.  Aroma of milk chocolate.  Nice flavor of roasted coffee with a smoky edge.  Subtle and complex.  Find this one.
Second rate: unfiltered version at phredriks local in Aalborg, Denmark. Equally fantastic, the anise comes through a bit more in the nose, and the earthiness is more pronounced - you can almost taste the stones!

11.2oz bottle. Poured a dark black with brown edges and a larger sized off white head. Aromas of chocolate caramel, some dark fruits, smoke, and licorice. Tastes of some roastiness, chocolate, coffee, licorice, and very light dark fruits. Lacing left on the glass.

pours black, nearly stout-like.  nose is heavy smoke and leather and sweet dark molasses.  mouthfeel is smooth and relatively thick.  heavy taste of smoke and burnt wood with a hint of sweet fruit.  cant really make out the licorice as one would expect.  exceptional porter, one of the better ones out there.

Bottle at PIB. Poured a deep, dark brown with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is smoky, chocolate, dark fruit, molasses. Flavor is smoke, leather, dark fruit, chocolate, very roasty. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy and very enjoyable. Would love to try more Baltic Porters of this caliber.

Incredible Baltic Porter much closer in spirit to Synebrichoff or Carnegie than other Baltics. Viscous, deep, dark, smokey, bitter sweet, ashy goodness. Amazing that people freak out about Abyss when this is widely available.

Bottle marked with 01.07.09 on the front. Pours with a large, creamy, deep brown to nearly gray head, over a near black, cola brown body. Very nice rings of lace and solid retention. Aroma of doused mesquite smoke, smoked barbecue meats, plums, dark fruits, molasses, chocolate. Taste is burnt wood embers, smoke, dark fruits, leather and a ton of roast. Slightly metallic and milk chocolate finish. Creamy mouthfeel with light carbonation.

I am not a fan of very smokey beers, so that might have hurt this beers score in my book.

Bottle on 06/14/2009. Dark black body with a large rocky light brown head. Roasty, chocolate, and molassas aroma with a bit of smoke. Sweet smoke, chocolate, and light molassas flavor with faint roasty notes. Medium full body with moderate carbonation.

Brewed in Denmark.... Pours a very dark brown almost black in color with super thin off white head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, bitter chocolate and spices . Taste of dark chocolate, roasted malts, licorice, brown sugar and smoke. The mouthfeel is medium in body with some mild carbonation at first but finishes smooth as silk on the palate. This baltic porter is fantastic !!!

MANs Beer! Deep ruby-black that is semi-translucent with red-gold highlights. Espresso-foam color thick deep cap that settles to a tight foam ring. Great smoky and roast aromas, toffee, alcohol, prickle of hops. Taste is boldly smoky and roast, with dry hops on the palate. Theres some coffee and petrol, and a veeerrry long feel of dry roast in the palate back to the sinus. Herbs and licorice. After so many designer beers of the Pan-Scan region, this is a hearty beer of authentic character. Quite DRY Baltic porter! Does have a bit of tannic red wine like finish, and slight stem-green feel. There is much to like in this beer, quite enjoyable, and drinking eight more would probably hurt the next day.

Bottle. Black colour with a pale brown head. Aroma: roasted malt, smoke, tar, licorice, some hops. Flavor: roastiness, lots of licorice, a bit of smoke, tar, coffee, hops, some saltiness, bitter chocolate. Very tasty.

Thin creamy medium tan head, blackish-chestnut opaque body. Aroma is smoky dark roasted malts, a little salty, belgian dark chocolate sauce, and beef jerky. Flavor is a bit of anise, then roasted/burnt caramel malt, salty smokyness, and a dry/salty finish. Bitter dark chocolate aftertaste and faint boozyness.

Bottle, Johns Grocery, Iowa City. Inky black, good swath of cappuccino foam. Aroma is starkly, dramatically: charred meat. Halfway between the smell of backyard grilling inferno and the smell of branding cattle. There is a little chocolate sweetness buried under all the meat, but it competes in vain for attention. Flavor is more meat and char, a bit of milk chocolate. A decidedly mixed set of characteristics borne along in a very soft and appealing full palate. As a pairing to steaks "grilled" by being subjected to a three foot column of flames, this might be perfect. Sipped on its own, it embodies a certain appealing punk aesthetic of destruction and noise, but it hasnt bothered making friends with me.

Bottle:  The aroma consists smoke, chocolate, caramel, and light roastiness.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small soapy beige head.  The flavor starts with caramel and chocolate.  The finish is moderately smokey with a some light roastiness.  Medium bodies with moderate carbonation.
Light malty and chocolate aroma. Huge, creamy and light brown head. Excellent lacing. Fully lasting longevity. Black body. Moderate bitter with taste of dark chocolate.. Medium palate.

(Sample Date: 6/13/2009   Source:Other)   Double Brown Stout "Ale brewed with spice (licorice)" 7.9%ABV Bottle courtesy of Maniac. Deep caramelized sugars with almost some smokey, creosote like notes in aroma. Black with a large fine tan head. Flavor of caramelized sugars, licorice, creosote, and smoke. Finish is dry with grainy astringency, smoky, peaty, and quite bitter. Very interesting and tasty beer.
Aroma of salt and red wine.  Lager yeast also, in the flavor and aroma. Very thick, and nearly still with almost no carbonation.  Some tannins and red wine, sweet, dried fruit and wild grass.
dark brown color with a smooth toffee flavor, malty aroma and caramel nose. slightly bitter flavor.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2009 The aroma is very toasted with licorice, sea weed, smoke, and coffee. The appearance is dark brown with a tan head. The flavor is like the aroma but with a burnt rubber finish. The palate is thick. This isnt low quality at all, I am just not a fan.

the aroma reminds of band-aid with a decent amount of dark roasted malts. the palate is very full with heavy on the malty. the bitterness is very potent yet it slightly remains in the background.  has its qualities.
Pours very dark brown with dark tan head. Roasted malt, smoke, and chocolate aromas. Toasted malt, smoke, coffee and anise flavors. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Very nice.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2011 Tap @ FairBar. Very dark brown almost black body with medium light brown head. Flavour is deeply roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, bitter and liquirice.

Just about black in color with a small/medium lasting light brown head.  Roast, light smoke,  some dry chocolate, molasses, and light spice in the aroma.  A good amount of roasted malts, some molasses, and smoke in the taste.  Solid malt backbone with some licorice hints.  Bought this one on a whim and I am glad I did- a very solid strong porter.

[Bottle, thanks Guerde!] Pours dark brown with a dark tan head. Aroma is mostly smoke and deeply roasted malt, with light milk chocolate, Taste has alcohol, smoke along with char, and anise. Good mouthfeel, incredibly long mouthfeel. A very solid beer that is bordering on too deeply roasted, but manages to pull it off.

(bottle) Pours dark brown with a thin tan head that leaves a little lacing.  Smells of smoked bacon, salt, wood, roasted malt, burnt graham cracker, and tart berry skin.  Tastes of chocolate, light smoke, and salt, which is then signaled by a spike of roasted malt that rounds out to a nice and smoky finish which lingers very well.  Warming reveals just a touch of dark fruits. Eventually after the smokiness subsides, a bit of bittersweet chocolate emerges upon exhalation on the finish.  Mouthfeel is medium and carbonation is as well.  An interesting take on a baltic porter.

Bottle shared by NachlamSie. Pours a very dark brown with small tan head. The aroma is cherries, ash, soy sauce, licorice, and some sweet meat. The flavor is extremely ashy, but in a good way. It has a nice thick meatiness with some smoke and soy sauce. A bit of sweet cherry floats around in the background. It finishes with some ashy bitterness and a fairly subtle licorice note. Pretty good stuff.

Bottle split with Tronraner. Pours like cola with a bubbly tan head. The aroma is very roasty, ashy, meaty, with lots of soy sauce and licorice. Slick mouthfeel on this one. The ashiness and meatiness of this beer is very apparent in the flavor. Licorice is in the foreground with lots of soy sauce and a dash of chocolate. This is a very, very tasty brew.

Bottle, thanks to badgerben for sharing.  Pours a dark brown, almost black body with brown head.  Aroma of dark malts, grass, salt, licorice, and cocoa.  Flavor is the same with more of a smoked character.  Medium body with a long roasty finish.

Sampled from 335ml bottle during Akevitts Scandinavian Beer Night and shared by JK. Pours a semi-hazy brown colored brew with a thin beige head that quickly dissipates to a film top and thin white ring. Aroma of toasted dark malt, chocolate, a hint of vanilla, smoked wood and a touch of floral hops. Taste is medium to full bodied, with flavors of smoked dark malt, egg shell, some vanilla, bacon fat, and burt toast. Finish is semi-dry with a smoked dark malt and hollow hop aftertaste.
Scandinavian Beer Night.  Black, slightly brown color with no head.  Salty and strong malt aroma.  Lots of smoke, salt and dry malt flavor.  Dry, dark chocolate finish.  Really tasty.

Pours dark brown with amber hues and full cratered surface of the moon dark mocha texture. The aroma is moderately rauchy with bits of smoke, campfire char, bacon and a dash of band aid. In the background behind the smoke I get roasted malt notes and dark fruitiness. The taste begins a bit roasty to go along with a layer of dark fruitiness like dark grape jam and ripe plum. Toward midway an assertive rauch-ness surfaces bringing with it notes of smoke, charred wood embers and a touch of band aid to go along with spice and black licorice. The smoky notes and sweet dark fruitiness take this into the finish with little to no roast or char. It is rauchier than I expected. I feel compelled to type, yum.
Bottle. Black colour with a light brown head. Very roasted coffee and chocolate aroma.

Bottle, courtesy Ibrew2or3. Dark brown pour, dark tan head, thick wet lacing. Sweet nose, some dry smokiness, some caramel. Flavor is chocolate, with sweet fruits and a fair amount of smoke, some roasted coffee, sticky caramel in the finish. Thick, full-bodied, balanced and good.

Bottle. Pours a bubbly coffee brown with a bubbling and frothy dusty brown head. Rich roasted malt, dusty smoke. Flavors are roasted malt, chocolate, pepper, faint alcohol, mild licorice. Mouth is full and chewy, well carbonated. Real good.

pours dark with heavy ring of tan suds.  Nose was somewhat brine-ish like olives, definitely salty with a nutty, almost chocolaty background and maybe a touch of vanilla, though not in a creamy type way.   Very nutty flavors, with peanut skin flavors, and again, somewhat salty..with a chewy smokiness behind everything.  Palate is somewhat tinny...with some of the metalicness leaking into the flavor profile..

Thanks to Tony at OTH for recommending this one.  Pours a dark brown with medium white head.  Aromas of spice and roasted nuts.  Tastes of caramel, licorice and choc coffee.  Very good and might be the best porter I have had.

Pours a deep brown with a thick tan head. Big smoky roasted grain aroma with a hint of chocolate, the smokiness almost makes you think this is a smoked beer. Medium thickness, chocolate, smoked malt and dry hop bitterness all come out in the taste. Good complex porter that is very well balanced and very easy to drink. Excellent.

This was quite unique.  Ill admit that I was a bit frightened by the mention of licorice, as I detest that flavor, but decided to go for it anyway.  Poured jet black, touch of brown at edges, with a lovely compact tan head.  Aroma was thick roasted malts, venison marinated in worcestershire sauce, a touch of anise, and brett.  Flavor matched.  Much funkier than I had expeted, with a hint of smoke mixing in with the anise to make it so it all worked somehow.  Very complex, quite the sipper.  Dont know if I would reach for it often, but a really cool beer.  Loved the barnyard brett influence in this thing.
On tap at Lord Nelson. Pours almost black with a dark brown head. Smells quite smoky with hints of malts. Taste is smoky with hints of licorice.

thanks to Solan!  Molasses and caramel on the nose, malty aromas with hints of spicy hops.  Pours dark brown almost black with a very thin tan head.  Bittersweet chocolate upfront, molasses, with hints of a nuttiness, some toffee notes as well.  Nice roasty  notes and very smooth with very subtle anise.
Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Smells and tastes roasty and lightly bitter with a nice element of licorice on the finish.

An extremely dark body shows virtually black, and is crowned with a head of dark khaki colored foam. Feathered, sheety lacing coats the glass well. The nose shows a strong smoky and gamey overtone, with biting, dusty brett notes lending an "ancient" sort of feel. Underlying malts are comprised of ultra-dry, dark cocoa and traces of dried caramel. Burnt licorice and pepper notes lend spicy complexity. Flavors are equally impressive, rich and ultra roasty, with a decadent dark cocoa base being accompanied by a myriad of earthy, dusty, bretty notes and a strong overtone of old oak. The palate is substantial, semi-lively, and bone dry, with an obvious brett feel that lingers long and bitter. This falls somewhere between foreign stout and Baltic porter, with a hefty bit of smoke mixed in for good measure. Outstanding brew if youre into the dark, bretty beer vibe.

courtesy of ibrew2or3.
pours black, mocha golden head.
Aroma is smokey, with notes of caramel and chocolate.
Taste is similar, smoked malts, some dark fruits, and hints of chocolate flavors.
Seemed a lot closer to a stout than a baltic porter.Excellent brew.
Black as coal with a small tan head.Licorice and chocolate with a lovely roasted aftertaste.For about 10 danish kroner or a quid...this is afind.
Pours dark black. Roast barley, some smoke, slight coffee nose. Bitter, charred flavor, with some coffee lingering. Excellent porter.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2009 Pours a lovely glassy very dark brown with thin dense beige froth on top.  Fruity grassy aroma, lots of roast, smokey/earthy, hint of acidity.  Very nice baltic porter, flavors are melded and soft, hard roast, a touch smokey, slightly metallic, touch of fruit, brown sugar, old chocolate, bitter roast, has some old-ale characteristics, slightly pungent, vinous, almost vinegar, with underlying acidity.  Richer aftertaste, dark chocolate, dull licorice, grassy hops and sour milk. Medium/full bodied, full creamy oily mouthful with larger but soft carbonation.  8.4.8.4.17 [rerate 11.30.09] 8.4.9.4.17, infection in full effect, really really nice!

Pours black with a light brown head that lasts surprisingly long. Aroma is smoke, roasted malt, earth, ashes, coffee. Flavour is intense, coffee, sweet malt, hint of chocolate, earthy hops, and loads of smoke. Reminds me of Haandbryggeriet Dark Force minus the vinous part. Thick, smooth and chewy.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2011 Bottle from Maria, the Danish beer queen.  Pours a charcoal black color with a tan head that quickly dissipates.  This beer smells like Swamp Thing.  I mean, its like a glass of blended sticks and mud.  Easily the earthiest beer Ive ever smelled.  Tastes of burnt coffee, malt, apple seeds, and moss.  Highly original.  Not for the faint of heart.
Second bottle courtesy of hellbilly -- thanks for the re-rate!  Loaded with smoked malt, licorice, molasses, and sticks.  Reminds me a lot of Bells 9000.
Bottle.  Pours a dark brown body with a tan head.  Hints of licorice and spices, turpentine, sweet malt notes, some roast y coffee and some smoked malt in the finish.  Interesting brew.

11.2 ounce bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a VERY dark brown color appearing opaque in the glass. Medium creamy brown head shows good head retention and lacing. Aroma of roasted malts and smoke. Taste is roasted malts, smoke, spice including anise and coffee. Slightly bitter finish. Smooth and full bodied. Very nice beer.

completely black and opaque under a medium sized frothy brown head.  campfire, woody, burnt, roasted aroma with a touch of sour red wine.  flavors of hay, cow feces,  the barnyard bigtime!  tastes like the scent of a petting zoo.  strange stuff.  somehow i like it...a lot.  this is a must try!

Licorice is quite evident. Alcoholic. Bitter, long aftertaste. Not fantastic, but nice.

 Purchased at SuperBrugsen Halmtorvet for 10dkr.

Bottled, Body is black, the head is light brown and it disappears rather quickly. The aromas are of smoke, tar and coffee. taste is very much like the aromas a bit thick. 

A very good everyday beer
Bottle. Almost black body. Pale brown head. Light aroma, some coffee. Heavy flavour of coffee and alcohol. Warming. Bitter roasted finish. (Lorry, Oslo, 07.07.08)
Bottle. Dark brown - almost black with a big lasting beige head. Aroma: Tar, liquorice, smoke, malt. Taste: Smoke, bitterness, malt, liquorice, coffee, chocolate. Very nice beer.

Bottle. The beer smells light sweet of caramel, also a little bit of coffee and molasses. The head is brown, foamy-creamy and medium large, rather fast disappearing. The body is black and strong. The taste is bitter and dark, malty. Long duration. The Porter is creamy and light dry without much carbonation.
Bottle. Dark almost black body with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, liqourice and smoke. Taste is liqourice roasted malts and coffee. Nice bitterness.

This poured black in color with a fluffy light brown head that faded slowly.  The nose was complex with aromas of strong coffee, dark chocolate, crème, fig and plum.  In the mouth it was medium-bodied with a concentrated midpalate that had fresh carbonation.  The finish was lingering with dark chocolate, bitter coffee and mineral dominating.
Black of color with a creamy brown head. An aroma ofsmoke and liqurice. A flavor of smoke, liqurice and roasted.
UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Black with huge deep beige head. Aroma has roasted malt, coffee and liquerice notes. Roasted malt int the nose along with tar, smoke and liquerice notes. Finished dry.

330ml bottle (Fish and Beer, Copenhagen)
Black, brief fizzy tan head. Aromatic chocolatey and burnt aroma, not huge, but most pleasing. Quite lively carbonation. Richly roasted malts come to the fore, but leave a quite potent acrid one-two of hops and burnt malts on the palate. Decent residual sweetness, but as the fruitier vapours rise up your nose you realise it’s alcohol that’s carrying them there. Quite a smack in the chops, but not entirely unsophisticated. Needs to lose some fizz and thicken up a bit, then tone down the charcoal to get really big points off me. Probably better draught.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Re-rate 11/27/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks Yoav. Dark brown to black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee, a bit of dark chocolate and light dark fruits hints. Pleasant chocolatey and coffee-ish flavor with a bitter roasty finish. Medium to full-bodied. Really good. 7/4/7/4/15=3.7

Bottle (thanks Dedollewaitor! At least one good Baltic Porter arrived safe!). Black-colored, quite opaque, with a big, bubbly, light brown head. Heavily roasted malt aroma with decent smokiness, some toast notes and some light chocolate hints. Sweet and lightly acidic malt flavor with roastiness, light smoke, nice chocolatey tone and some fruity hints. Finishes dry with light alcohol notes. Medium-bodied. A good solid Baltic Porter. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2016 faint dark fruits, coffee, roasted stuff. quite balanced. black/dark dark brown, with huge brown head.
flavor is coffee, roasted stuff, faint faint fruits (mashed banana) - so faint it actually adds character. nice. (2008-09-18).  7,4,8,3,15.
50cl bottle. 2016-02-04. pitch dark to very dark brown, brown smooth head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, charchoal, hard roasted malts. 8. deep black,deep smokey malty nose,roast malts bitter chocolate. coffee. dry hop in linger. very warming but a bit rough
Bottle. Pours a dark brown / black colour with light brown lasting head. Aroma is coffee, roasted, smokey, caramel. Flavor is roasted, smokey, coffee, malt, hops. Very good.

Bottle. Pours almost black with a creamy, lacing, light brown head. Smoked, roasted malts aroma with salty meat and caramel. Good smoked meat flavours moderated by caramel sweetness. Good balance. Full-bodied without being sirupy. Has become a Nordic classic.

Aroma: smoky, fresh fruit, wax, dark syrup, toffee/caramel, flowery hops, roasted almonds, licorice... 
Flavour: weird, slightly of cardboard. Bitter, orasted malt. Slightly of pinesmoke & rubber. Bitter cocoa aftertaste. Roasted nuts, liqueurish but subtle sweetness of malt, figs & licorice. 
Palate: fluffy but rather thin. Low to moderate carbonation. Lathery. Pretty good. 
Appearance: very dark reddish brown with brown-tinted head /thick, lacy, lathery foam).

Pours a nice deep color almost black with ruby highlights comign through and a nice cramy tan head.  Aroma is roasted barley, chipotle smokyiness, and charred burnt malts.  Lots of char and smoke in the flavor almost a nice meaty bacon rauchmalt quality with more roasted almost coffee tones coming through, and a nice solid mouthfeel and good clean finish.  Nice strong porter for sure.

Bottle at Chris_Os 19th April 2008 tasting. Pours black with a nice aroma of dark malt and smoked meats. The flavour is similar but the palate could do with being a bit fuller. Not bad, but not really great.
UPDATED: DEC 9, 2008 Bottle. Really dark color with a brown foamy head. Really rich taste of licorice,coffe,chocolat and also som roasted and fruity notes. Really good!

For some reason I have tastet this one severel times, but not rated it yet: Bottled, pours pit black with a stabil, light brown head. Nose of tar, liqourice and dark, smoked malts. Sweet complex flavour with roasted malts and coffee. Full bodied. Long bitter and dry finish. Very tasty.
Very dark beer, with brown head. One of my favourites. Rich velvety taste with licourice, coffee and a tad baconish.

Bottled 33cl. Tasted at wedding, Tisvilde. Complete black body with medium brown head. Very, very good porter with hints of bitterness from dark chocolate and coffee but at the same time sweet - good balance. I have to taste it again someday!

Dejlig dejlig porter som min og min mand har drukket i mange år. Denne smagt samme aften som ØF porter, og derfor er den blevet sammenlignet lidt med denne.
Dyb sort farve med brunt skum. Røg og lakrids i næsen med det samme, som går igen i smagen. God solid bitterhed som harmonere med sødmen.
Bottle. Pours pitch black with medium brown head. Tar, chocolate and burnt malt in the nose. Smoky flavour, espresso, tar, and lots of roasted malts in mouth. Good stuff!

Bottled(330ml). -Courtesy of faroeviking (thanks a lot for this one Jacob!) 
Deep black coloured, medium sized brown head, smoked ham nose. Burnt malt, smoked ham and bitter coffee taste. Very oily and heavy brew, but all in all quite good porter.

Bottle shared with ogivlado who received it in a trade with faroeviking (thanks to both of them). Poured a murky black colour (some red tinges near the bottom) with a medium-small dark tan head that went away slowly.  Nice.  The nose is quite smokey... smoked ham, roasted malts. The taste is definitely smoked ham, almost pancetta, sweet and pleasant, roasty maltiness with some coffee near the end. Not terribly complex but still an interesting, very good porter.
Flot mørk porter med masser af røg som jeg kan li det. God sødme og lakrids smag og flot skum.

Thanks to yespr for the beer! The bottle looks really good. The beer in the glass is incredible. Very dark, nice head. Tastes very malty, strong and dry, not too scratchy. Porter is not my favourite style, but this one is really good!
(Draught at HBF2008) Very dark brown colour. Light brown medium sized head. Sweet nose containing bit of roasted malts. Taste contains roasted malts, a bit of coffee and also liquorice.

A Mes rate: bottle at Chris_Os Ha Ha Ha Ha Gimme the Cheese Tasting.Black with a slim tan head. Smoky and roasty malt with some very slight liquorice and coffee notes. Pretty much straight down the line but rather dominated by the smokiness. A decent bit of Baltic.

This was a warmup for Oak Aged Yeti stout. The aroma has smoke, hops and coffee. Its similar with the flavor smoke and hops, but a very good balance between the malt.

Bottle from fonefan on 11/14/07.  Pours with little head, but consisting of dark tan microfoam edge around the glass.  Clings nicely when I swirl.  Pitch black liquid.  Very dry burnt roasted coffee flavor.  Definitely not my favorite style.  I prefer sweet thicker porters.

330 ml bottle. Black body with a thin rust-red head. Aroma is sweet liquorices, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is rather sweet, gently roasted, a bit fruity (dry fruit), leather and liquorices.
