Must admit that the oldest version tasted a bit better even with a little hint of oxidation. Dont know if this has something to do with the brewery or the storage. Probably a bit from both.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2008 Bottled (TNX Totte!) Thick opaque black, thick brown head. Very strong roasted aroma with some liquer in  the background. Very full-bodied. Alcohol comes through a bit too strong. Very nice smokey roasted tasted and oh those fine malts dominating everything!  I wanna have this for breakfast and not Muesli!
Bottle. Dark brown with a light brown head. Stale smell of potato cellar and used coffee grounds. Mild bitterness. Soft mouthfeel.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2011 Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Black with medium beige head. Roasted aroma with dark chocolate, smoked sausage, and tar. Medium bodied, soft carboantion. Semi dry, medium bitterness. Okay, but not my cup of tea.

.33 l bottle thanks to Papsoe.  Pours an oily black with no head.  Aroma is smoky with coffee and ash.  Flavor is smoky, but does not overpower the way some smoky beers do, coffee and roast malt.  Mouthfeel was medium-to-thin, similar to other porters in that way, with a little bitterness in the aftertaste.

0.33 l bottle. Pitch black with creamy tan head. Sweetish aroma with coffee, leather, nuts, salty llicorice and caramel. Sweetish, vinous and coffeish flavor with notes of wood, caramel, apple, chocolate, smoke and some sharp alcohols.

Bottle: Impenetrable black! As is often the case with dark beers this was a little thin aroma-wise. A slight hollow roasriness, but that was all. However, in the mouth velvety roast flavours play over a quiet caramel note. Theres some peppery alcohol and grainyness here too, but really its all about the simple harmonies of the caramel and the roast. Just lovely!

33cl bottle, with thanks to sunevdj.  Pours a dark brown with a large choppy dark tan head, nice lacing.  Aroma is dominated by smoke, like venison jerky, with some charred/burnt malt, light chocolate, and saltiness(?).  Flavor is more of the same, although more mild and seems to work only slightly better together than expected.  An interesting and mildly unique beer, although not one Id seek out again.  Still, glad for the chance to try.  Baltic porter?
Very heavy. Tasteful, some sweetness on the palate and some smokiness. Yo have to like this kind of beer to be enjoyed.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2009 Limfjords Porter delivers a characteristically smoked hint along with chocolate and (light burned) coffee taste; very tasteful! A rather inexpensive beer (No Offense)!
In its plain look it might fool someone not to buy it... but DO try it! Enjoy - one of a kind! Very, very good on tap!
bottle at plan b, copenhagen. boot polish colour with a steady light brown head. roasty, instant coffee aroma. plenty of burnt flavours, very dry and drinkable, tasty stuff
(Bottle)  Pours a black body with a medium brown head.  Aroma of roasted malt, smoke, coffee, and dark chocolate.  Flavor of roasted malt, cocoa, and light coffee with a dry, bitter finish.

Courtesy boboski. Black/dark brown. 1cm cramy light brown head. Smoked deli meat, burnt malt, dark chocolate, whole grains, subtle whole coffee beans, and some cookie like malt. Bottle from Engelsmann drunk on 6/28/07Nice fluffy brown-tinted-beige head atop a glowing, ruby-amber body with low carbonation and a high clarity.  Head eventually recedes to cover, leaving light lacing.Dates, hazelnuts, marzipan, toffee, brown sugar!!  Wow, this is some decadent stuff, but at least quite complex.  Liqueur-like alcohol warmth mixes with the sweet, above-mentioned notes, while a profound toffee maltiness soothes the nose.  Towards the end, I get an interesting note of bitter orange peel or resin, that seems to sit on the back of a lightly smokey, moderately roasty note.  However, it ends decidedly more clean and sweet, with vanilla and brown sugar mixing together and tapering off in a toffee laden finale.  Medium strength of aroma, no flaws.  Interesting and like many of these cult beers, the complexity/originality of it is its strong point.Raisins and toffee keep things sweet as I take a sip, while the smokiness comes out even moreso in the flavor.  Really unique, lovely mix of dry woodsmoke, alcohol warmth and sort of a rum raisin note, for lack of a better descriptor.  Top this off with some brown sugar, a very soothing, malty texture and medium-low carbonation that stays out of the way, and youve got yourself an excellent sweet sipper.  Vanilla and oily prune-like vinousness dance about on the finish as well, and the smoke is done tantalizingly tastefully.  Dosent blow you out of the water, but keeps you wanting another sip.  On the sweet side, of course, but dosent bludgeon you with crude sugars or a syrupy body (though with warming and breathing, the creaminess does begin to get a bit heavy).  Dosent seem like much of a baltic porter to me.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2009 Flaske. Flot sortbrun farve med et klassisk brunt porterskum. EN smul røg i duften, men den rammer først for alvor i selve smagen der er domineret af røg og tørv. Superlækkert.

33 cL bottle. Pours utterly black with a chocolate creamy brown head. Thick roasted and smoked malty aroma, notes of chocolate and coffee. Medium bodied. Lovely thick chocolate, liqourice and coffee flavour. Thick smoke note into the bitter finish. A true classic and a masterpiece amongst Danish brews.

Black with a decent brown head. Powerfull complex aroma of smoked malts, english liqurice, tar and black chocolate, very nice. Flavor is so smooth and enjoyable. Thich creamy raw coffee and chocolate, again with a smoked touch. The taste sticks in your mouth like tar and leaves a nice smooth smoked and roasted bitterness. This is an exelent piece of maltwork.
Bottle. Black with a light brown head. Smoke! A lot of smoke for not being a dedicated smoke beer. Also notes of coffee,  brown sugar and maybe some caramel. Medium body.

33 cl bottle.  Almost black with a moderate tan head.  Smoky coffee, tobacco and mild brown sugar.  Starts with black licorice tang and unsweetened chocolate.  Smoked prunes and dry molasses add just enough sweetness to balance the dark roast.  Mellow bitter finish.  Espresso and a cigar; wonderful.
Bottle.  Dark brown, with a thick tan head.  Impressive malt aroma, with vanilla and coffee standing out.  Medium body and bitter (from the burnt malt).  A bit dry.

Bottle. Black, creamy porter with a thick stable head. A flavor with smoke, coffee and dark chocolate.
Bottle courtesy after4ever. Pours an opaque black with a lacy tan head. Coffee aroma. Medium-full body with a sweet and almost salty taste  of coffee chocolate, Dry finish.

Bottle. Thanks for sharing heemer. Poured an opaque black color. Attractive khaki head. Very rich aroma of chocolate and roasty malt. Wow that smelled good. Tasted of dark chocolate and coffee with a hint of burnt stick. There was some roasty bitterness at the end. Delicious. Excellent beer.

330. Thanks, Maria! Deep dark opaque black. Huge tan moussy thick head. Lots of clingy lace. Smoky dry nose. Coffeeish. Medium body, soft carb. Ultra dry ashy body. Finish is smoky, ashy, and chalky. Courtesy boboski.  Pours black with a medium light brown head.  Nice sausage, smoke, dark malts, and heavy roast swirled around my nostrils.  The flavor wasnt nearly as smoky but very delightful. A little alcohol is present with a great smooth chocolatey finish.  Fantastic!

Courtesy boboski.  Pours a nice thick dark chestnut color with bits of light tan head swirling around.  Smells real smoky right off, but a nutty roast aroma comes out more as it warms.  Rich, creamy palate.  Smoke, Brazil nuts, chocolate on the taste; nice roast character through the middle.  A very rich, full brew - earthy like a cup of dark coffee.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2007 Medium sized creamy head, tan with white remnants. Light, soft looking lacing. The body is a sensuous shade of dark auburn brown with shimmering blood red peeking out from deep within. The head diminishes somewhat, leaving fat groups of bubbles at the edge - the clusters resemble an outline of flower petals around the visible body. What a shocking aroma! Moderate smoke entanged with heavily roasted grains, Dutch chocolate and bristling with caramel and aniseed. Alcohol is well concealed thus far. Starfruit, raisin bread and peanut butter make flighty appearances. This is utterly complex and certifiably one-of-a-kind. Smoke in the nose is reminiscent of the effect of running a beer through lines that accomodated a rauchbier not long ago, such as the residual effect noticed all too easily (and to my delight) in Schlenkerla Helles. A marvelous addition to most any roasty beer, certainly permissible in this scenario. Flavor is chock full of the aforementioned components, but the center of attention is the roast and smoke one-two punch. Bitterness is mild to moderate, sweetness about the same. Alcohol is still fairly well masked. The last part of each sip gives me a feeling that resembles just melted chocolate gliding slowly down my throat. The finish is very smooth, leaving behind a lightly smoky and heavily roasty and chocolatey blend, as well as lingering hints of vanilla and scorched earth. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, velvety, but unleashes crushing malt and the palate is overall very affable. Carbonation is medium but remains soft and enhances the drinkability. An absolutely wonderful treat. This will remain a sought after beer for me. A few more should do.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2008 Tried again recently, still a great brew, thanks Joey. Wow, thanks a lot to oh6gdx for putting this in a trade! The body was perfectly black with a khaki colored head. The aroma was nice and roasted with soybeans and some excellent coffee. The taste was strongly roasted, almost smoked, with a lot of coffee. There was also some green bean character, but it was complementary, not detrimental. An interesting and subtle brew. I would love to try this one again.

Bottle thanks to bierkong, Jollyest of jigs ipa spinning shackel party, gareths. Aroma is roasted malt, smokey and coffee. Taste is roasted oats, sweet with quite a bit of carbonated, a decent porter but not my bag really.

Gorgeous ebony colour with a thic brown head. Aroma is of coffee, smokey malts and some dark chocolate.  Deep roasted character. Highly pungent with a good bittering and dry finish. Lovely maltly flavours linger in the mouth.

Pitch black with a thick brown head. Coffee, Hops, a bit of smoke and roasted malts to the nose. Flavour is smoke, lots of roasted malts, liquorice with a nice rounded bitterness in conjunction with a nice maltyness. Leavs a long aftertaste.

bottle. Deep black, with a thick brown head. Nice aroma - Chocolate, smoke, coffee, liquorice, and malt. Big chocolate malt flavor, with roasted malt and some bitterness. Long roasted malt finish. Really nice beer; great example of the style.

(Bottle, Ölbaren, Copenhagen, 19 May 2007) Black colour with foamy brown head. Heavily roasted nose with notes of black coffee, chocolate and liquorice. Roasted taste with distinct coffee notes, some chocolate and liquorice. Some citrussy notes in the rather bitter finish. Very well balanced, with coffee being the predominant factor. Great porter!
Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of rye, roasted malts. Quite sweet taste, roasted malt and rye again. Hint of chocolat. Decent balance, but not spectacular in taste.
Bottle. Black colour with large creamy light brown mostly lasting head. Spicy aroma with hints of coffe and chocolate. Sweet spicy flavor with bitter finish.
Opaque, brown head. Chocolate, rye and malts in aroma. Sweet flavour, coffee, bitter in finish.

Bottle: Black coloured with a small, beige, lacing head; dark-malty, barnyardy and a bit vinous nose; full bitter-sweet flavour, full bodied; shorter sweet-bitter finish with traces of roasted malt and dried fruit. Good, but shoul have an better aroma.......

Thanks to thewolf for this beer. Thick black poor with a sticky foamy brown head.  Aromas of hickory, moca coffee, hint of vanilla, bananas and makes me think of a nice night around a camp fire... You cannot feel or taste the alcohol.  Good bitterness, dark bitter chocolate... Very evolutive palate... Creamy mouthfeel.  Long lasting Smokey bitter taste that turns slightly sweet towards the aftertaste.  Very good beer, this beer is an obvious stout...
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2011 Bottle 33 cl. Black color, nice brown head. Smoked malt and liquorice. I love it.

Pours dark with a copper head from the bottle-even though I brought it back from DK a couple of months ago. Smells great and looks great too. 
There are some hints of coffee, licorice, and smokiness in the smell-but it isnt overpowering at all. I think that it drinks relatively smooth for a beer with an ABV this high, but it isnt for the faint of heart as it is a porter (or Double Brown Stout according to the label.) I could drink these all night as they arent too filling initially, but you do feel the ABV a bit after drinking it so watch out!
This is becoming one of my favorite beers from Denmark and I will continue to bring at least a bottle or two home from each visit if I can.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2009 Tasted 2007-03-22. Fresh bottle, 33cl. Dark brown, almost black, colour with a staying grey/brown head. Coffee aroma. Very bitter taste of coffee og smoke. Very creamy og full bodied. Will retur to this one after its had some years in the cellar. - - - - Re-rate: after nearly three years in the cellar, it has IMO improved. I get the same flavours, but its alot less rough, than I remember the fresh one to be. Next time will be a side by side - old vs. new.  Raised the overall from 15 to 18, and the palate from 3 to 4.
Ends 2002. Pitch black with light brown hue and small, slight brown head. Still got alot of coffee, chocolate and hints of smoke. Really got balanced by aging!!

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2007 Very dark beer with mahogany highlights when held against the light.  It poured with a substantial foamy tan head.  Sweet roasted grain nose that moved toward smokey charcol as it warmed.  Lots of burnt toast, dark brown sugar, molassess, some sweetened coffee and a fig fruitiness.  There was a long dry burnt astringency in the finish.  Very full mouthfeel.  If you like burnt grains, this is your beer.  Many thanks to Santa Papsoe for this treat.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2007 Aroma of chocolate malts and roast, smoke,  prunes, oranges. Some hints of coffee and rye as well. Thick, black coloured with a lasting, brown, somewhat fluorescent head. Taste is sweet, chocolate-bitter, fruits, (oranges/citrus), smoke, some sugar and hints of coffee malts. Well bodied and well balanced. Excellent brew.

Great thanks to Maria for sending me this wonderful beer.  It alone is worth further first hand research at the brewery.  Methinks another beer tour is slowly creeping upon the horizon.  Pours a medium/dark brown with a fizzy, nearly soda-like head.  Settles to gentle mocha crater.  Sweet nose of caramel and sugar. With intense dry malty body with strong black patent crisp finish.  A pretty ring of carbonation along glass.  Thanks for your local brew Maria!

Im lucky that this world class beer is available in many of the restaurants and inns around here, where the alternative is a more or less boring pale lager (Im allergic to wine). The first time I had it - I was terrified! But later when I started to appreciate the stouts, it soon became one of the favourites. The body is pitch black and the head is huge, creamy and dark nougat brown. The aroma has notes of smoke, tar and licorice and the mouthfeel is oily. The flavour has a lot of bitter chocolate and licorice, but it also has notes of coffee, smoke, roasted malt and a lot more. Its like this beer is an on-going experience, I find new sides of it every time I drink it. Sometimes it feels rough and raw - and sometimes its like smooth and fine velvet.
Its a very, very nice beer! Rating # 500

Bottle. Pitchblack with a good creamy brown head. Aroma is slightly burnt, smoked, a bit of chocolate, some grassy tones. Extremely creamy mouthfeel. Taste has smokyness again, more coffee and especially burnt flavours. A citric bitterness creeps in at the end.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2014 Bottle provided via trade with fordest and then again at home on 7/29/14 via bottle from North East Wines & Spirits. Pours opaque black with a small rocky and large bubbled light brown head, mostly diminishing with spare lacing. Aroma is heavy roast and coffee malt, molasses, light earthy and herbal, woody hops with dark fruit notes and wood, smoke, tar and charcoal. Flavor is lightly tart and bitter dark roast and chocolate malt, coffee notes, dark candied fruits, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Full body, medium carbonation and light astringency.

Bottle. Black body. Creamy light chocolate head. Nice and interesting  aromas of smoked meat (spekeflesk), tar, juniper, espresso and bitter chocolate. Amazing! Taste is slight sweet with burnt and smoked dark malts. Also licorice and mild alcohol. Medium-bodied. Long tart finish. What a Porter!

[Tasted february 2005.]
  
Smoke is the very first note about this beer. Had this beer after it had been for 2 years in my cellar. Not much hoppy and the smokeness was more in balance with the maltness. Very nice and Ill think Ill bring some more to my celler.
This beer has a nice brow colour littel light brown head.Super tast of roasted malt and liquorice.Even your grandfather will like it.

Bottle. Thick black colour with a nice light brown creamy head. Aroma of smoked wood and tar indeed, along with well roasted malts and bitter-chcocolate. Flavour is bitter,smoky, thick tar, liquorice, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Aftertaste is long with bitter, smoky, roasty with some chocolate. Great brew indeed!

A dense brown head tops of the jet black beer. The aroma is heavy on chocolate, coffe and roasted grains, but its still quite clean. The taste is of bitter chocolate, burned wood and birchwood smoke. The finish is dry and slight bitter with the chocolate flavour lingering for quite a bit.after subsequent sips the smoke gets more up front. 
The beer is thick and fills the mouth perfectly.
A very nice beer. Supposedly the brewer has been developing the it for quite some years. So no wonder it turns out this great!

Pour is deep dark brownish black with a dense light brown head...smell is  smokey and roasty with some cocoa and light notes of coffee...but moreso smoke than anything else...mouthfeel is nice and velvety...taste is roasty cocoa and strongly smoked...I have to guess this is a smoke beer more than a porter....wonderful smoke flavors...the 3 best smoke beers I have ever had in my life have been Danish...that is pretty awesome...if this isnt a smoked beer, then I got a bad bottle that I loved.

My rating is coloured by the fact, that I´m not so fund of porter. Anyway a dark brown beer with medium brown head. Aroma of malt and licorice.

Aroma is fairly smoky with some anise, followed by some roasty malts and a vinous and raisiny character.  There is also a tinge of saltiness and acidity. I would say this medium bodied, though it seems a bit watery.  I know this doesnt really make sense, but this is how I feel.  Carbonation is low and fairly sharp.

text: Black colored, little beige head. Aroma is good with "rauchbier-tones": strong smoke and ham dominate, sweetness, mild alcohol and hints of licorice also there. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is milder with still good smoke and some roasted licorice. Coffee and chocolate in aftertaste.

I like the new Danish microbrews, but you are not to laugh of the old danish breweries either. There are some real goodies between; for example this Limfjords Porter named after a beautiful Danish inlet. The head of this beer is big and beige, and diminishes slowly. Its colour is completely black. The aroma is very smoky with coffee beans, a lot of roasted malts and a little sourishness too, which I think is rather typical for Thisted Bryghus beers. The flavor is smoky with obvious coffee and liquorice and a constant bitterness from both malts and hops. In the aftertaste this dry beer becomes very bitter from the hops, and has a lot of smoke and liquorice. The body is just perfect for the beer, and it is very creamy. Maybe this beer is not brewed with the same care as Ølfabrikken Gammel Ekstra Porter, and maybe there are not used as big amount of ingredients, but the smoky flavor makes it at least as interesting, if not more.

i like stouts and porter - this is my favorite one. Very strong taste and thick body: roasty, chocolate, coffee, very black. Good beer to mix with other liquid, for an example "snaps", pilsner, citrus etc. U gotta try Limfjords Porter!!!  ;-)

I usually prefer thin white girls, but this thick black baby is a charm!

Hard liquorice, even rough, doesnt dominate, but is memorable along with smokey toffee. The liquorice is really what did it. Even if it felt a bit harsh it came off feeling right for the overall taste.

Poured black with a large brown head.  Nice roasty aroma with coffee, chocolate, tobacco, dark fruit. and smoke that came out  as the beer warmed.  Bitter sweet chocolate and roasted malt flavor.  Dry finsih with a good bitterness.

Aroma has undertones of clay but is overpowered by a nice smoke sausage. Taste has a magnificent old school liquorice which danes and icelanders know very well, smoke aftertaste with a tiny hints of malts and garlic. Nice and subtle

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2010 Pours black in black, with dark brown foam. Roasted coffe and chocolate aroma. Massive roasted aroma with chocolate, coffe and bitterness. Great beer indeed.

Thanks Matt. Opaque jet black with a moderate brown head. Full aromas of peat, smoked salmon, mild coffee and dark chocolate. Flavors of caramel and fully roasted malt. Mild tobacco and black malt acidity. Tons of dark hearty bee qualities. A cool weekend working around the house type brew.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2006 Black with a tightly packed brown head. Aroma is very smokey, with some coffee and something stale. It reminds me of the small and taste of a smoked mackerel. there is a little bitterness and a smokey/off fish aftertaste. Not too pleasant, but definitely interesting and awsomely cheap. Rerate, on tap at Plan B
Murky brown, hoppy aroma, thick, packed with hops, amazing... a completly different beer. So good.
Some smell of horse blankett (not good), better in taste, smoke, tar , dark brown with off white frothy head, light bitterness and some saltyness
Pre-GTMW tasting @ 1FastSTis place. Light brown with tan head. The aroma is roast, bread, caramel and smokey. The flavor is chocolate, molasses and smoke. Medium body with soft carbonation.

Aroma of grapes, vinous chocolate, flowery figs and some more chocolate. Nice and fruity.  Dark brown in color with a thin, brown head.  Milk chocolate flavor with a touch of roast and smoke.  Fruitiness carries over from the aroma into the finish.  Medium to light body that is very drinkable.  Interesting, thanks to MrFacto for sharing.

Bottle. very dark beer with beautiful creamy head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate and burned malt. Before I tasted Limfjords Porter i thought that portes was for old people, but this beer really opened up my eyes. This is a really great beer´.
Very dark color with a nice pale foam. A lot of chocolate and coffe combined with a burnt and slightly salty taste.

Bottle, shared by MrFacto - thanks, Matt!  Barely translucent and mahogany in color with a glacial thin dust sheaf and cathartic tan doily rungs.  Dark rustic cocoa beans roll in muddy mulch as the aromatic sequence begins, meeting up with tobacco seed, stork chocolate reisens, and prunes scattered amidst charcoal ash.  Smoky tobacco prevails more in flavor with a bit of singed ash tree and charcoal traces.  Dry, smoky flair weaves between milk chocolate and bittersweet bricks.  Hint of sulfur arises but is bested by roasted pecans frolicking in cocoa dust.  French roast grinds scatter with mocha beans and then get whammed by a hammer.  Supple carbonation promotes the medium-body while a dry, roasted chocolate tract bows with coffee grinds at the curtain call, along with an encore of dark cigar wrappers and corresponding seeds.

Opened as the night was winding down, this was a nice treat.  I havent had

Bottle thanks to bager.  Darkest brown with a light brown fizzy, noisy head.  Aromas are burnt chocolate, and coffee,. Thanks Lars for coming all the way From Denmark to hang with me and bring me this beer.

Bottle. Coffee, chocolate, hops: citrus, grass, brown-black, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, hint of salty, full body, creamy, average carbonation, medium finish and a little smoked in the flavour.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2007 Coffee, chocolate,  hops: citrus, grass, brown-black, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, hint of salty, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2012 Black with fine browny creamy head. Aroma of burnt malts/chocolate & coffee. Medium carbonated. Texture is filling and very smooth and soft. Finish has slight bitterness.
 A porter with power. Truly incredible!
Notes from a Pre 1970 bottle: Liquorice, caramel and port. Wauw.. Smooth. Impressive!

330 ml brown bottle. Small dark beige head that fades away. Black color, perhaps cloudy. Burnt aroma, coffee, citrus. Salty taste. Very special taste. Tastes of seafood (!). A little smoked in the flavour. Not my kind of beer, although it is complex.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2006 (Blind rating at sk8vikings.) Pours black with a foamy off-white head. Sweet with aromas of smoked malts, liquirish and a hint of band aid / ropes. Medium bodied. Cryspy, dry finish. I´ve got a couple of bottles in the cellar... I think they will improve.

12 oz bottle, via sk8viking.  Pours a pitch black colored body under a creamy tight bubbled chocolate brown head.  No sediment in bottle.  Aroma is of chocolate and roasted malt, rather dry with a light hoppiness and lots of caramel.  Flavor is very dry as well, first I get burnt malt, roast, dark chocolate, and coffee. UPDATED: JUL 15, 2006 Like taking a bite of a ship, coming to harbour, after 10 days on the sea -Smokey tar.
Brown head, almost black beer.
Roasty malts, chokolade, smoke, sweet bitter finish. A good old favorit.

I have to tell you this. I went to Roskilde Festival again this year, and brought me some of this beer. I have never enjoyed a breakfast beer this much before. So if you ever go camping, bring some Limfjords Porter for a breakfast snack !! Lovely... i love it !!

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2006 Guiness-like pour, creamy brown color, extremely thick creamy tan head. Roasty smokey chocolate aroma. Hmm... flavor has a lactic thing to the background and finish that makes it seem authentic. Lingering dark bitter chocolate on the tongue. Really good porter.

bottle via trade with radiomgb - Thanks Jeff! - Pours black with a creamy tan head that stays fairly well and leaves some lace. Bottle. Black colour with a light brown head.. Very roasted coffee and chocolate aroma. Sweet roasted mocca flavour. Bitter finish.
bottle. pitch black with thick dark brown head. tastes like tar and rope... in the good way :) smokey roasty malt. chokolate light cofee. great beer.

Bottle courtesy of BierKonig. Dark brown to near black. Foamy brown head. Nose is nutty and sweet with light coffee notes, bittersweet chocolate and sweet malts. taste is sweet and malty with more light coffee notes, nutty flavors, chocolate and roasty malts. Rich full body. Creamy and smooth with mild carbonation feel. Finishes with more caramel, light coffee, nutty notes and chocolate.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2009 Bottle: Dark brown/Black colour, with a thin brown head. Aroma of coffee, salt, tar and wood. Flavor is almost the same her, and thats nice, medium body, and a long bitter/tar finish. Nice Baltic porter this one!

To mark the salt of the earth on the first of May I chose a black porter topped with a delicate brownish foam leaving pretty lacings on the glass. Smoky mouthfeel containing coffee, anise and chocolate flavours. Smooth. Malty flatness to finish a decent Danish brew.
Blacker than black, even my shurefire cant shine throuh is. An Incerdle beer. A very good morning beer " Limfjordspoter - not just for breakfast any more" :-)

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2006 Tasted blind at Sk8vikings amazing Porter/Stout tasting - Black body, big creamy head, laces; A little smoked bacon, brown soap, cold espresso in a quite deep but unpleasant nose, some alcohol and a bit of bitter licorice gives it a bit balance; Very soft velvety body, with very soft carbonation, balanced but very neutral; into medium long finish with some bitterness, again smoked animal, which is unfitting. Unpleasant, but complex and deep------- then black, thick brown head, leaving thick laces; Very small indistinctive nose, mostly just the carbonation, but also very little chocolate, coffee; Balanced body, great carbonation (no character); Finishing long and metallic, bitter, a little salty medium fill medium length, no particular aroma, again a little chocolate and a little coffee. This beer has almost no aroma (nose and finish) and is almost only feel. I find it super boring (3-4-4-3-7).

Very dark black/brown pour....brownish head.  Big smoked malt nose...yum.  Flavor is full of roasted malts...coffee notes, and a big smokey malt presence.  Nice bitter end too.  Nice smooth mouthfeel....medium to full bodied.  What a great porter.  Thanks Rene!!

New Years baby! Thanks to BBB63 for giving me this gem. Pours a pitch black color, small off white head. Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, roasted coffee, chocoalte, very pleasent. Flavor is smooth, slightly burnt, lots of dark chocolate. Tasty stuff, not normally a fan of the style.
Botte 0,33l.  Completely black with a  brownish creamy head. Smells burned. Burnt aroma - and leaves a burnt aftertaste.

Bottle - trade with chris_o.  A black beer with a really nice frothy tan coloured head, although this disipates faster than I would have liked.  The aroma is very smoky and oily.  Obvious roasted malt in the nose.  Taste is very dry and smoky; quite burnt and quite tasty although I feel theres something lacking in the finish.
Very dark color with great head. Very stout-like but with clear liqurice flavor. Else burnt bitter coffee taste.

Bottle. Brown creamy and very appetiting head. Pitch black body even though I did as always, held it towards a lamp, aroma of tarred rope. The rope is also tastable in the flavor but not it is added liqorice. Add a nice hops aftertaste and youve got it.

Small, tan, normal-laced head. Opaque black body. Dense licorice aroma with faint notes of wild berries and coffee. Dense, powerful taste much like the aroma, bitter, burnt aftertaste with lingering coffee taste. Sweetish. More of a stout, IMHO, but still very good. Perhaps a bit lacking in complexity.
Shared by Matt!  Dark brown body, thick tan head.  Roasty-tart aroma.  Rich mouthfeel.  Chocolate, lactose, hint of tart cherry.  Great flavor.

Dark brown to black pour w/ a huge frothy brown head w/ some nice lacing.  Roasted malts some roast grain notes vanilla and chocolate.  Palate is oily well coated light creamy.  Flavor is roast malts chocolate roasted grains and vanilla.  Verry good.

Thanks to MrFacto for sharing this beauty that was on my want list.  The beer pours to a really dark cola body with a thin white head.  The aroma is coffee and iced tea.  Very strong and very good.  The flavor is a roasty charcoal malt and coffee.  Very balanced and very good.  Nice roasty full bodied palate.

Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown colour, big foamy head. Aroma of smoke, coffee and.. bacon? Taste follows aroma. Thick palette. Perfect as a companion in the owen together with meat. My favorite good night beer! :)
Dark brown, some minimal foamy tan head. Nose is bacon. Taste is bacon, some sweet mocha, and more bacon. Smooth finish. Interesting.

12oz bottle from madsberg! Pours a dark brown color with a foamy light brown head that receedes to a ring around the glass. Nose is salty, hammy, bacon like. Taste is chocolatey, more meaty smoked bacon and ham, and some notes of coffee. A thick, fluffy mouthfeel, with a velvety coat lasting on the tongue.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2005 So - my first rating. This is one of my favorites. Really dark and rich in taste. A bit smokey and "tary" and maybe a little touch of coffee. Very smooth in the mouth. Exellent.
P.S. I just corrected my rating - I am new so I didnt do it right *S*

Bottle, BB 2.17.06.  Thanks to sk8viking for this Danish beauty!  Poured a very deep mahogany with ruby/brown highlights.  Sizable toffee-colored head sticks around for quite a while... and nice intricate lacing followed the brew down.  Aroma of heavy burnt chocolate malts, licorice, tobacco, and soap.  Full-bodied and smooth on the palate, with espresso bitterness around the edges and at the finish.  Some light astringency.  Flavors of roasted and burnt chocolate malt, licorice, a hint of alcohol, and some tobacco on the finish.  Roasty bitterness remained for quite a while.  Very good brew!

If you are in the mood for this kind of beer it is a go-get. Just so full of taste, aroma and taste. My fav. "go to sleep" combo is an old rasputin (north coast brewing co.), followd by a Limfjords Porter. Great taste-combo, please go there...
Fantastic creamy lightbrown head fully lasting head. Fine aroma with lots of chocolate. Long finish. Great taste

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2008 Bottle. As this one was brewed by Urban until 1986, and I had a bottle made by that brewery, I had to taste it. Not sure how old it was, there were no indications of date. It poured an almost clear, dark brown body, with a minimal head, actually next to none. There were chocolate, licorice, dried fruits, some smoke and a touch of oxidation in the aroma, the kind of aroma one could sniff for minute after minute. The flavor didnt reach the same level of joy, but was still good, with licorice, roasted malt, some oxidation, a touch of cigar and a vague bitterness. Rather thin in the mouth, but lovely! Rating: 8-4-7-3-15-3.7 (071228)Bottled. Black with nice, cramy, tan head. Heavy roasted malts and coffeebeans in aroma. Lightly smoked aroma too. Flavor of dark, bitter chocolate, roasted malts and hops. Some salty licorice in the back. Finishes with a nice medium bitterness that lasts for a while. I was advised to put a bottle or two away for a couple of years, and so I did. Looking forward to taste them in 2008 or maybe later. (051109)

Bottle Pours black with a small, creamy, beige head. The nose is all chocolate, caramel and smoke. Well-balanced flavor with notes of chocolate and light smoke. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Finishes very lightly bitter. Thanks go out to JensenTaster for sending the bottle.

Thick black porter with strong stouty taste, cocoa, brown nutty oily beer, alcohol. Only a tad sourness but well balanced, malt. Roast, tabacco, pepper, coffee, licorice, Full mouthfeel, well carbonated. Original something I have never had.
Thanks Madsberg.

33 cl.
Nice black/brown color.
Good flavour / smoke / Malt / Coffee
Medium body.
Creamy texture.

33 cl bottle. No yeast in bottom. Very black colour with a nearly creamy head. A really pleasant smoke aroma. I love this flavour of roasted malt, smoke and hints of coffee it ends very smooth and tasteful.
Soapy cocoa-colored head.  Very hoppy aroma.  Tobacco taste at the end.  Slight burnt taste that lingers on the palate.  Nothing spectacular.

Out of bottle,thanks rich.  Aroma of strong hops and mud.  Pour was a dark brown.  Flavor was dark roast almost burnt, peppery and tobaccoish. Palate was okay but I just couldnt get past the earthen dirtlike taste. Overall it was okay just not for me.

dark brown with a fizzy ring around the edge of the glass.  nose has burnt malts and licorice.  flavor is very burnt,  with a peaty tobacco  finish.  the burnt flavor is  a little bit too heavy for my liking.  there is a distinct hoppy vein running through the background on this as well.
This is the best porter ever made. Black colour with aroma of licorice and malt. huge brown mostly lasting head. Smooth taste of chocolate and a full body.

Quite creamy and roasty with a burnt mouthfeel - like a charred tree.  Vinous and thick with plenty of flavor.  Tar-like in some ways.  A serious stout-ish porter for purists.  Not to be trifled with.  Perhaps the slightest hint of alcohol, which is remarkably subtle given its ABV.  Well done!!!!  A superlative example of the best Denmark has to offer.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2007 Fantastic creamy lightbrown fully lasting head. Fine aroma with lots of chocolate. Fantastic taste of very bitter chocolate, Long finish, a wonderfull beer. One of the best buys in Denmark.

On tap at Christian Firtal, Odense.  Very dark, very smoky. Loads of coffee and dark chocolate. Licorice too. Quite a lot of sharp bitterness and some woody notes on the finish. Full mouthfeel. Theres a lot going on, but the abiding memory is of the smokinesst. Top notch.

Bottled. Black opaque colour with meadiumsized brown head, which disappears quite fast. Roasted malt, licorace and toffee in aroma. Strong licorace and roasted malt in flavour along with strong black coffee.

Bottled
Opaque black, vanishing brown head. Roasted, licorice aroma. Full-bodied. Alcoholic, full of licorice, a bit smokey, roasted malts in the finish.
Black with a large off white head. Nice chocolate and liquorice aroma. Flavour is similar, with some nutty notes. Full oily feel. Nice stuff.

(RBESG05, bottle) Brown-black body topped by a tan head that leaves great lacing.  Aroma is medium sweet, cocoa, some roasty.  Taste is medium sweet, cocoa, light roast, faint alcohol.  Smooth, soft, medium-full body.

Bottle at Olbaren during RBESG 05 pub crawl. Served to me by Jacob Lovenlund, who also produced his own version of this beer for RBESG, but with a bottle of whiskey added! Deep black, with a big brown head. Aroma - oily and understated. Oily mouthfeel. Smooth hazelnut flavour - no the strength I was expecting, but balanced and tasty. Good Porter, but not as different as I was expecting.

Deep, impenetrable black. Complex aroma features dark chocolate, coffee, black licorice, malt, steel and smoke. A good, rich mouthfeel. Generous dark chocolate flavour is extremely rewarding, and is complemented by layers of coffee and licorice on the finish. Very, very nice!

Black colour, with a thick beige head. Salty nose with hints of tar. Flavour from liquorice, tobacco and coffee. Both aroma and flavour reminds me of the sea. Quite thick mouthfeel. Long roasty/burnt finish.
Bottle.  Very impressed.  Smokey and deep in character.  BLack as night and filled with a full body carrying notes of coffee and heavy spice.  Like a cross between a rauchbier and a porter.
Bottle. Smokey, nutty, hints of flat cola. Lots of smoke and ash, but in a very good way. Quite enjoyable.

After a run of average porters, this took me in a new direction, and it is easily the most sympathetic of the beers I had.  big coffee, roasted, with big-time smoke notes.  Not a lot of carbonation and not too much going on in the finish, just a mild bitterness and an array of wholesome roasted malt flavors.  Good stuff.

black with a reddish tint and a grey head. sweet roasty aroma with a vanilla note. taste is strong roast wood flavor with a nut flavor of pecan and almond. smokey sweetness really comes out later in this. clean finish of bitter coffee and chocolate with the bitter fading to a rich nuttiness. a good one. thanks to Bierkonig for sending this gem.

Appearance is perfect! -Although its whats the inside that counts. (A little not too clever allegory.. sorry). Pitchblack and with a creamy head which color resembles roasted marshmallows. Flavor is delicious. Liquorice and roasted malts and a slightly bitter finish. But this is heavy stuff. I might consider mixing some of it up next time..

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2006 (Bottle 33 cl) Pitch black with a thick, creamy, sticky and retentive head - but a lovely appearance. Smoked and burned nose. Medium-bodied with very burned - almost tar-like - malts and a smoked touch. Rather discreet bitterness. A beer with a great personality. 020606
Simply a wonderfull beer! Very dark and malty and with a nice stable head. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso and smoke is present in the taste and nose..

Bottle: Black, dark brown edges, large light brown head, rocky, wonderful lacing.   Roasted malt, slight smoke, subtle wet sock aroma.   Malty, charred wood, light but smooth on the tongue.   Fairly sweet, slight lactose as well.   Not big, but nice body and smooth.   Milk sugar finish, on a bed of roasted malts steeped in coffee.   Soft hop appearance too.   Tasty!   Thanks Lars!

Dense creamy head. Opague. Aroma has malt, caramel, coffe and chocolate. The flavor is even more intense: roasted malt and coffee hide  the malty sweetness. Cacao. Thick mouthfeel. Very bitter. very complex and very powerful. A world class beer, without any doubt. Thanks Ivo K., for bringing me this one!

Beautiful aroma of coffee and black currant. Black color, brown creamy firm head, good lace. Light sweet, bitter, roasted, coffee, fruity. Very thick like porridge, very warming. Thanks Dalle for this excellent brew!

Black, creamy brown head. Big and deep aroma of dark chocolate, smoke, tobacco and anise. Thick intense flavour of black coffee and vlack chocolate. Hints of tobacco, spices and cocoa powdrer. Long bitter aftertaste of spices and espresso.
dark brown, coffee and chocolate, and a bit smoky with a bit of sweetness.. lets open another one!

Thanks to Madsberg for sending this gem my way!
Dark brown and totally opaque liquid fills the glass under a tall head of mocha brown. I think the head is thick enough to hold up a cherry! It clings to the sides of the glass ans it slowly eases its way down.
Even when cold, this gives off lots of coffee and chocolate aromas. Maybe some smokeyness as well.
The flavor is burnt marshmallows on the front and some sweetness towards the end. The delivery is full bodied and smooth. Very nice.  Skål!

Bottled. Deep black colour. Small, brownish head. Chocolatey, caramelly aroma, notes of smokiness, but altogether not a very strong aroma. Flavour is dominated by coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. Slightly sweet, ending in a lasting coffeish, bitter finish. The best part of the beer is the mouthfeel. Chewy, thick body. Creamy mouthfeel. Really, really nice. Thanks to joss for providing me with this superb beer.
33 cl bottle. Served in stem glass. Black. Good-sized brown head. Heavily smoked, powerfully licoricey. Big in every way.

To be honest - im not crazy about porter. However, Limfjords porter is virtually undrinkable. Beautiful colour though. Tastes like someone left a pot of liqurice burning on the stove and then tried to clean the pot with beer.

Very dark brown, almost black beer.  Thick dark brown head that lasts and lasts.  Sweet malty aroma, light fruitiness (cherry/prune) with a chocolate coating.  Toasted malts and faint coffee notes.  Full-bodied with a thick chocolately mouthfeel.  A hint of licorice and smoke on the finish.  A very tasty brew.

Bottled and tapped. Black thick beer with a really nice smooth, brown head. Very complexs with a taste of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt and smoke. It has a nice bitter finish. Perfect on a cold winterday!
Smooth oily dark beer with plenty malt -  roasted, tar, smoked, subtle complexity of sweetness/caramel, nice bitter roll-off. Hits like a sledgehammer.

Black colour with a huge creamy brown head.
It has the typical stout aroma with notes of liquorice and smoke. The aroma is a bit like the smell of new-tarred fishing nets.
Powerful flavour dominated by liquorice and smoke with notes of coffee. Nice bitter finish.
This beer is nice on a cold winterday, but much too powerfull and heavy on a warm summerday.
But be aware it can give you serious hangovers.

Black-brown color with cardboard colored creamy head. Aromas of black chocolate, expresso coffee ( ILLY ) black drop, some hops and faint touch of bayleaf in the nose. Full taste with oily mouthfeel. Good burned aromas of coffee, black chocolate, caramelised edges of a fruitcake that has bin too long in the oven, black indian tea and a vegetal freshness of hops and mint. Aftertaste is smooth and ends with a exellent fine bitter touch. Thanks Jeppe (Bierkônig) for this very good Porter.

Bottle, at home.
Dark body with light brown head. Aroma of burnt malt and moderate hops. Notes of smoke, tar and liquorice. Bitter finish, long. Either you like it or hate it.

Bottle @ HBK Black Beer Festival, Nynäshamn Backlog 26 Nov 2004Sorry, no hit for me. Though others at this festival praised it. Smelled like a poor homebrewkit. Had some culliflower in the aroma, mixed with fried bacom. Fat.

Nice thick, dark brown head.  Quite large and lasts for a while.  Settles nicely and slowly.  Low carbonation.  Nice roasted grains aroma with some coffee and a touch of soy sauce.  Color is a very, very dark brown.  Rich, thick flavor.  Not too sweet.  Tons of malts, more coffee and roasted grains.  Some bitterness.  More bitterness and dryness at the finish.  A very good baltic porter.  Thanks to Dixen for this tasty brew.

A really strong brew. Big dark lasting brown head on an almost black body with aroma of burnt malt and a bit of fruit. It does not taste fruity, but is very filling and has a healthy hoppy taste, with a bit of caramel, prune, and other fruits. This brew is reputed to be Denmarks best porter beer, and the reputation is deserved. Remarkable beer !

Bottle via Secret Santa: Almost black with ruby highlights topped by a lasting frothy tan head and outstanding lace. The aroma has noticeable black malt characteristics: chocolate, smoke, tobacco, prune, walnut, aromatic hops, dusty and earthy yeast notes and just a whiff of alcohol. The taste is shocking in how much the bitters and burnt/smoky notes dominate. Subdued sweet caramel flavors dance upon the  tongue before giving way to some nutty qualities.  A spicy and almost tannin like finish with lingering bitters. The feel is lively but not overpowering, dry and astrengent. I would like to see the palate be a bit more creamy. Overall, a solid brew with a lot to offer but lacks completeness to be among to best in genre. I would gladly try one again if given the chance.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2005 33 cl bottle. Black, with wonderful rocky head, that drags belgian laze as you drink the beer. Perfect, and not too powerful, carbonation and excellent mouthfeel. Taste is malty and dominated by smoke - maybe a bit overpowering. Filling without being sweet.
Dark, dark, dark with a very roasty and burnt taste. For the first time in a very long period i could not drink one hole beer.

Sampled with omhper, tiggmtl, MartinT, muzzlehatch, and Rastacouere in Montreal.  2003 bottle thanks to Per.  Chocolate and coffee aroma with slight DMS notes.  Nice smokiness in this bad boy as well.  Opaque dark brown with a khaki colored head.  Roasty and sweetness comes through towards the end.  Slight alcohol notes are also present.  Smooth.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2005 Smoked malt aroma with some roastiness apparent. Opaque borwn with decent, off-white/tan head that recedes to thin cover. Smoky malt flavour with nice roasty bitterness. Medium body and very easy to drink.  Bottle enjoyed with DYCSoccer17, MartinT, muzzlehatch, Omhper and Rastacouere.  Resampled at Olbaren and again at DenverLogans GABF tasting with similar notes and scores.

omhper in Montreal #10 (with MartinT,tiggmtl,Rastacouere,DYCSoccer).  Dark, thick, slightly oily brown slick appearance...rich, intoxicating licorice/liqueur-infused chocolate nose, just stunning...massively roasty, dark and bitter body belies the sweet nose...smoky, with just a bit of anise keeping the center calm...strong, assertive, bitter finish.  Among the standouts of the night, right on Per!

Dark ruby. Light chestnut foam yields sticky, snowflake lace patterns. Abundant notes of nougat, roasted wood, coal, and smoke permeate the nose. Lightly vinous with fruitcake, molasses, and black currant hints. Tightly carbonated. Somewhat airy. Slightly smoky and rich with a buttered caramel and soft, rounded roasted malt mesh. Roastiness slowly tapers off, giving way to charred wood notes. Highly attenuated, but perfectly sweet, with touches of mocha, vanilla, and bittersweet chocolate. Minimal oxidation offsets some of the sweetness. Light breath of wintergreen-accented alcohol discharges a delicately spicy anise ester, which intensifies the multilayered earthy malts. Relentless char astringency dries it out, backed with a hint of tar, while pummeling the dark fruit nuances in the finish. Aside from the lightly oxidized aroma and flavor, this should only improve as it ages. Already decadent, though, as is. Thanks, Dixen!
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Dark, with a thin oily head.  Loads of nicotine in the nose and a bit of pine.  Nice smoky flavor, good roasts and chocolate, and a rich molasses finish.

Very foamy medium off-white head tops a dark brown body. Appealing chocolate and licorice nose. Meaty, smoky, roasty, vegetal. Intense licorice flavor in that one though they managed to keep a restrained sweetness level. Once again feels rather vegetal. Nice chocolate/coffee roastiness. I cant find anything bad to say about this no-weakness brew, a greatly blended baltic porter. Huge props to Per!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2010 Succulently smoky dark chocolate notes hugging raisins...Powerful hops and roasted malts confer eternal bitterness to the licorice-y chocolate sweetness...A  flavorful Baltic Porter which possesses a memorable personality, as well as all the qualities which, to me, are required for the style...
Pours black in black, with dark brown foam. Promising aroma, and the beer more than delivers. Roasted coffee is prevalent. Excellent beer.
A very dark almost black porter. Full of taste - notes of tar, oil, licorice. A bit to heavy for me.
Wauw! Really a heavy porter. Full of taste - notes of tar, oil, licorice. Reminds me of my youth when the fisherman were preparing their nets with tar. Black as the night.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2004 Draft at The Wharf, Aalborg, Denmark. Pitch black with a nice creamy beige-brown head (possibly because of the use of nitrogen). Sweetish hoppy and malty aroma - not so powerful in the beginning, but becomes more powerful and gets an oily character as it warms. The flavour has a round bitterness. Hoppy and with burnt coffee and somewhat oil- or tarlike. Wholesome, soft body. Really nice, but tends to become a bit too much as it warms. Other than that its pure dynamite, baby!

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2004 There aint a damn thing wrong with this fantastic beer. Nice roasty aroma. The taste is medium bodied, with pleasing roasted malts. Light smokinesss blends together with a light cocoa flavor. The finish you can taste a bit of black licorice. Just awesome.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2004 Pours opaque black with a tan head and spotty lacing on the glass.  Roasted coffee, fudge chocolate, coconut aroma.  Oak and coffee, light chocolate, smokey taste with a medium mouthfeel.

Black.

A smoked baltic porter, eh? Sounds interesting. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, anise and smoked malts.

Notes of black licorice, smoked malts, roasted malts and a long, lingering finish of coffee, chocolate and wood. Quite tasty and rare. I am glad Ungstrup shared this with me.

Bottle courtesy of BierKonig.  Poured a deep brown color.  Nice deep brown head.  Good lacing.  Smoked and malty aroma.  Medium to full bodied.  Roasted malt and smoked flavor predominate.  Decent hopping balances out the finish.

Dark, black and what not. Tannish head. Big ol spots of lace. Aroma of smoke. Roast malts as well. Woody. Slight fruitiness. The smoke is still going strong in the flavor. There is a bit of roast as well. Mostly smoke. Very creamy palate. Finish is of roasted, smoky, woody malts. Pretty good stuff.

A solid midnight black midnight tar color with a light foamy dense tan head and islandic style lacing. The aroma is smoky with roasty licorice root and fruity strawberry notes. The flavor has lots of smoky sweetness and a delicious "lack of black patent" brown porter. This is another one of those chocolate milk with liquid smoke porters that I love so much. Baltic porters are the best but not as cool as Madsberg! Go Denmark!

Awesome stuff. Rich and chocolatey, very roasted, with a full, long bitter finish, very well balanced. So much chocolate, coffee and licorice, extremely tasty, perfect example of a baltic porter.

Bottled, a food for beer trade with Ungstup & MartinKurbert, at my house.  Now were talking this beer was right up my alley. Dark brown with juicy stained head. Lovely deep roasted ash flavours. Deep liquorice flavours that spiral down through your palate on, what seems like and endless journey. Yes please. Cant wait to dry it on draught as JacobL suggests.

Black brew.  Bonfire and fireworks nose!  Intense taste, roasted and burnt, with some bitterness and a touch of lactic to make things interesting.  A bit OTT in the roast, but a good flavoursome ale.  (Bottle in Ølbaren, Kobenhavn)

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2004 Great fullbodied, fulltasting porter. Rich on tar, licorice, heavy roasted malt taste. Should be enjoyed near the sea - for the extra aroma (or perhaps while dipping your feet in "limfjorden") ;)
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2006 330 ml bottle. Dark brown. Throws a tall white head. Long lasting liquorice and burnt coffee taste with a fishermans friend-like aftertaste. Dry aftertaste. Delicious.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2005 Black color with a big baige head. Coffee roasted malts heavy aroma and tastfe. Full body and a long bitter dry finish. Great.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [bottle] Poured like black oil into the glass with a very creamy and slightly bubbly tan head. Heavy roasted and burned aroma with a nice toast smell underneath. Lots of roasted malt in the flavor with a touch of dry earthiness and possibly cedar? Very creamy mouthfeel that actually left my palate dry. Very interesting brew. Thanks to Dixen for this one.

Pours a thick, oily, rich, darkness with a lacy dark tan head.  Aroma of mild earthy caramel and heavily roasted malts with a touch of lager yeast.  Starts sweet and somewhat syrupy with a subtle dark fruity complexity and lightly dry, roasty finish.  Hides its alcohol quite well, an enjoyable Baltic Porter.  Thanks Mads!
Dark, with a nice head. Aroma from coffee and chocolate. Brings a rather bitter flavor with coffe and some cocoa. A nice porter.
UPDATED: OCT 7, 2005 Rerate 05-10-07. Black, with a wonderful black head. Smoky tar aroma, cocoa and very dark chocolate. Hoppy tar flavor, very bitter after a while and with a hoppy finish.

Bottled.
Black with a brown head.
Rather dry with a band-aid-aroma.
Really longlasting, burnt flavour with some sea-flavour(?).

UPDATED: APR 5, 2005 Dark brown beer, weak toffee coloured head. Good carbonation. Flavour is dominated by roasted malts, liqourice, coffee? and some smoke. Sourness and a slightly bitter finish. Overall not bad but needs a more velvety palate.

Black with tan head. Roasted coffe and chocolate aroma. Massive roasted aroma with chocolate, coffe and bitterness. So delicious! And the best is that the pricetag is much lower than some of the more "fancy" micro breweries in Denmark!

Bottled. 
Black as the night. Brown head. Tarry flavour up front with a fruity background. Nice smokiness. Long finish with a great deal of bitterness. Full bodied.
Completely black with a nice tan head. Aroma is alot of coffee and some very pleasant notes of smoke. Flavor is very coffee-ish and smoky, very balanced beer.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2004 (on botle) Had this beer on tap before; but a good beer can carry a bottlet-life too. It´s fab, no doubt the best porter/stout I´ve ever had. Truely black and with a nose with the wonders of  malt, chocolate and smoke. Holding a small beige head throughout the whole tasting.
Lots of flavour,enough to call it a stout for sure. My mouth filled with a perfect balanced tastes from first sip to the last. And, my ultimate dimmand for a beer, the aftertaste, is beautifull. Quite a smoky sense comes lingering...I´m gonna get another one soon.

Bottled. Jet black, thin but lasting beige/coffee coloured head and moderate condition. Good sweet coffee and gently woodsmoke in the nose with a faint suggestion of lactose. Full bodied and sweet in the mouth with coffee, roasted malt and a gentle burnt raisin/ smoky note. Complex and evolving finish that starts coffee sweet, becomes roastily bitter and lingers long with wood smoke.

Thick, dark body and copious tan head, both of which were much fuller in appearance than I expected.  Sort of like the (in my opinion) Dark Lord of the Baltic Porter appearance world.  The aroma is incredibly strong and almost too much.  Super strong roasted malt aroma with bread turned charcoal, fresh ground coffee beans, intense smoke,  light notes of dark chocolate and a touch the aforementioned licorice.  Thick and full in the mouth, this is a creamy dream of a beer.  Incredibly malty with great roasted bitterness that just dominates the flavor.  The previously too-intense smoke comes to be a nice compliment to the insane malts.  A hint of chocolate and caramel sweetness moves to the forefront in the middle before embracing it's ultimate role as submissive to the massive malts.  Many thanks to Jeppe (BierKönig) for sending me a couple of these.  Seek this beauty out--it's worth the effort.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2012 Black body with a firm, light brown head. Aroma of roast malt, licorice and tar (harbour-like).
Rich flavour with coffee, wood smoke, more tar and licorice. A little sour with some bitterness in the finish, no annoying sweetness that can ruin a porter sometimes.

2005 beer, tasted end of 2007: Could the aroma get more intense of licorice, salt, tar, smoke, chocolate? The smoothness is overwhelming, and the flavour shows even more chocolate now. Perfect!

Pre-1970 Urban Limfjordsporter from Aalborg Aktiebryggerier. A bit dusty, cellary aroma, but excellent caramel and licorice character otherwise. Sweetish roasted flavour with a bit of charcoal, a hint of smoke and caramel, along with dust and cellar.
Liqourice to the aroma... Very nice head... Smooth round taste with a pleasant finish...
UPDATED: APR 27, 2005 Black. Dark brown head. Roasted smell of smoke and tar, perhaps also a little sour. Overwhelmingly full taste of coffee and smoke. This one is a winner.

It pours a very black colour, fine brown tainted head, very complex nose, roasted, aroma of chocolate and coffee, butter and nuts, thick and oily, strong bitterness with a long very dry coffeish finish - a beautiful beer, thx to BierKönig for this one !
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2005 Tar black in colour with a nice thick light brown head. Smokey malty aroma with coffee notes. Coffee and liqourice flavor. Long dry finish.

Thanks to yogi_beera for this beer.
It pours black with a light brown head. The head is quite long lasting. The flavor is sweet and refreshing, with a medium bodied.
almost black in colour, very strong foam after pouring it out into glass. Very chocolatemalty tast with fruity flavours. Mouthfilling until the very last.

Light toasted nose doesn't betray the big taste that is soon to come. Opaque black color and a big frothy sticky head. Very complex with tastes of dark fruits (plums, raisins) and a licorice even peaty finish. Borders on being a smoke beer. Thick body and an oily mouthfeel. Very long lingering profile.

Oih, what a nice one. Thank you so much Hobbit and Jacob - Dänemark lebe hoch! Chocolate and coffeebean nose. Opaque, little fizzy head, leaving brussels laces on the glass. Coffey, smokeey, bitter chocolate, also nutty and meaty taste. Smooth.

This beer is a classic for the style, the best I ever had.  Dark brown looks very stoutish.  Aroma is chocolatey and sour.  Flavor is burnt, sour and slightly salty.  Creamy mouthfeel with a bitter finish.  Many Thanks to Raindog for this one.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2004 Draught, pint glass. Dark brown colour with creamy, lighter brown head. The foam is not long lived, however. Flavour was intense, full and lasting with a good balance of smoke, licorice and hops (even some tar and coffee) which was well contrasted with the high alcohol content. The mouthfeel was thick and  greasy partly due to a low amount of carbondioxide which made drinking the beer very pleasant. Excellent!

Rerate, 33 cL bottle. The bottled version gave an even better impression with longer lasting head (a nice layer of foam remained until the glass was empty) and more details in the aroma and flavour. Reminds me of a good Islay single malt.

Near black with a big,brown head. Short lived but leaves ring. Sweet,dark fruit,roasty,slightly smokey aroma. Mouthfeel is creamy/oily. Body is medium to full. Flavors are sweet,with dark fruit,roast,and great smokiness. Smoke has a charred-wood character. Finish is bittersweet with lingerings of smoke. Nice smoked Baltic. Unfortunately my last beer from the trade with Madsberg(sigh).Thanks Mads.
Brown head, black body. Smoke, liqourice, coffee. Special and nice, but not my favourite.
UPDATED: AUG 10, 2004 Dark brown to black body with a nice foam on top. Taste is roasted malts with a nice balanced smokey finish.

Jet black. Very dark brown, thick irregular head. nose with dark & roasted malts, roasted barley, chocolate, mocca, black cardamoms. Very smokey taste, tobacco-like, and bitter choclate. Quite bitter overall, not only malts, I detect some bitter hops too. Retronasal the bitterness gets a tannine)like character. Quite full mouthfeel. yet this has refreshing capacities. Long bitter aftertaste. A beer with a bite, and one to bite in. Thanks for the tip, Josh.
It taste like I presume that a ashtray who is cleaned by this beer, therefore it is very smokey
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2003 What a flavor. Definately smoked malt and laquirce. One of the few porters thats not as the rest.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2008 Very strong and powerful beer. Black as tar and almost as thick. Notes of coffee, leather, tarred hemp rope and salty liqorice.. Strong flavour. 

A perfect example that excellent beer need not be expensive

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2006 Pitch black colour with an impressively lasting brown head. Smoky aroma with coffee and chocolate. Flavour has roasted malts and licorice ending in a LONG, dry finish. The first time a tried this it was too smoky and heavy for me. There is, however, no doubt that this is a fantastic porter and one of Denmarks finest beers!
black with a nice tan head.  big mocha aroma.  nice balance of flavours, burnt sugar, raisin, smoke, and roast.  very nice.

Near black colour.  Roasted espresso nose with bitter chocolate. Long, roasty flavours - lean and dry, with some burnt fruits.  The flavours are pure and beautiful.  Along with Koff and Zywiec, the class of the Baltic Porter style.

Black with a brown head.  Smokey nose, light roasty organic notes.  Body is nicely roasted with a good hint of smoke.  Chocolate flavors, finishes with a milky moutfeel.  Very nicely done baltic porter, I love this style more with every sample.

Its very nice that few separate elements of aroma work out so nice mixing them self together in neat blend. Very, very nice, attractive to my taste buds, he. Gentle but with character, got something special. That makes this Porter unique. Top Class.

Black with brown head.
Smoked aroma with salami tones.
Chocolate and coffee flavor with bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2003 A heavy mouthful from one of Denmark's few independent regional breweries, which I'm always happy to support every summer. A nice region with nice people who make several acceptable beers - this is their very best one. However, I have to admit that Gamle Carlsberg Imperial Stout Porter is slightly better. Rerate: Characterized as a 'double brown stout' by the brewery, this stout/porter (in Denmark that's more or less the same thing) is really so different from Gamle Carlsberg Imperial Stout Porter that it's a bit unfair to compare the two. The smoked flavour is really something out of the ordinary. I've never had a rauchbier (*I have now!), but I guess this one has some elements in common with that style (* smoky, but not smoked meat, T.G.). I highly recommend a sample of Limfjords-Porter! Rerate 2: Hey, this beer grows on you! Black (okay, extremely dark brown) as the deadliest of sins, moderate thick tan head, aroma and flavour of tar, resin and midsummer bonfires. Overwhelming smoked bitterness. Tastes like it's been stored in a Viking ship through seven battles and a round-the-world tour. Simply outstanding.

Definitely one of the more special and interesting Danish beers. The draught beer: black coloured. Roasted coffee and chocolate hints. Smooth though still heavy and full-bodied. Covers the alcohol well. The bottled beer:  which is quite different from the draught. More violent start. Less mild. A unike smokey nose and head. A bit more alcoholy.

Black colour, with a huge brown head. Smoke, chocolate, roast in the aroma. The flavour is mildly smoked and smoothe. Covers the alcahol well. Notes of chocolate in the flavour as well, and then a heavy and delicious bitter/smoky/chocolatish aftertaste. Lovely beer.
A black beer with a nice brown head. The aroma nice and that of smoked malt. The flavor is soft and dominated by the smoked malt. A really nice beer for a late evening.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2004 This is a beer that requires some training. 
Very full, with licorice, coffee, smoke in both nose and flavour. Looong aftertaste... First time I had it I rated it 3,1, I guess it grows on you.
Very roasted, very bitter. One bottle off this is almost too much!
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2006 3 different heads on top of easc other. Very roasted and a bit smoked. Bitter finish. Quite powerful and fullbodied. A great porter.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2003 Full bodied and rich in flavour. The smoked malt gives this beer its remarkable aftertaste. It is different from the other Danish porters. It is especially good on tap.
The dark smoked flavour makes this beer really special. Burned and licorice flavors and a thick mouthfeel invite to enjoy it slowly.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2003 Dark black, maybe because off the artificial colouring stated on the label. Big, malty body. Smoke and coffee in the palate. Rather sweet. A good beer, interesting beer. (6/4/8/3/15)
However like most Baltic porters this is ment for keeping and will improve significantly with time.
